title: Exclusive: Transak secures regulatory approval in two more states for crypto payments
body: Transak has secured Money Transmitter Licenses in Illinois and Missouri, expanding its reach into the U.S. market. The newly acquired licenses in the two U.S. states will enable the web3 payment infrastructure provider to operate independently in Illinois and Missouri, crypto.news can exclusively confirm. A Money Transmitter License grants firms operating in the United States the ability to engage in money transmission activities in compliance with financial laws and consumer protection regulations. For Transak, obtaining these licenses allows the firm to directly facilitate fiat-to-crypto transactions for residents and businesses in Illinois and Missouri. Since Transak will no longer operate under external provider licenses in these states, it can now offer faster fiat-to-crypto transactions without intermediary delays. Additionally, the firm can provide tailored payment solutions for local businesses that were previously restricted by third-party compliance requirements. The MTL also strengthens consumer protection by ensuring that Transak’s operations are monitored under state-specific financial regulations. Moreover, it allows the company to collaborate with financial institutions that prefer working with fully licensed providers. You might also like: Transak teams up with Uranium.io for tokenized uranium buys Illinois is recognized for its blockchain-friendly approach and serves as a hub for crypto innovation, with initiatives such as ongoing blockchain research at the University of Illinois and the Illinois Blockchain Initiative. Meanwhile, Missouri has a growing fintech ecosystem and increasing crypto adoption. Expansion of product offerings With licenses in both states, Transak can expand its services to include remittance solutions, payroll processing, and direct cross-border payments within a compliant, locally approved framework. Bryan Keane, compliance officer for the Americas at Transak, emphasized the firm’s commitment to adapting to the evolving U.S. regulatory landscape for crypto to provide users with trustworthy and compliant services. “Illinois and Missouri are just the start of what’s to come. We’re excited to expand our reach and support the digital economy’s growth,” Keane said. Headquartered in Miami, Transak continues to expand its presence in the U.S. market by actively pursuing state licenses. In November 2024, the firm was granted Money Transmitter Licenses in Alabama and Delaware, reinforcing its commitment to regulatory compliance and financial transparency.

title: Blockchain Association Urges Congress to Repeal IRS’s Controversial DeFi Tax Rule
body: Hold onto your hats, crypto enthusiasts! A major showdown is brewing in the world of decentralized finance (DeFi) and US regulations. The Blockchain Association, a powerful voice in the crypto industry, is stepping up to challenge a controversial new rule from the Internal Revenue Service (IRS). This isn’t just another regulatory tweak; it’s a battle that could significantly reshape how DeFi operates in the United States. Let’s dive into what’s happening and why it matters to every crypto user. Why is the Blockchain Association Declaring War on the IRS DeFi Rule? The Blockchain Association isn’t just any group; it’s a formidable force representing over 75 leading crypto companies, including industry giants like Coinbase, Kraken, and Uniswap Labs. When they speak, the crypto world listens. And right now, they are speaking out LOUDLY against a new IRS rule concerning DeFi broker revenue reporting. According to a recent report by The Block, the Blockchain Association is actively urging Congressional leaders to take action. Their mission? To repeal what they see as a fundamentally flawed and overreaching IRS rule. Senator Ted Cruz has already introduced a bill aimed at doing just that, signaling that this issue is gaining serious traction in Washington. But what exactly is so problematic about this rule? Flawed from the Start: The Blockchain Association argues that the rule is based on a misunderstanding of how DeFi actually works. They believe it’s technically impractical and conceptually misguided. Regulatory Overreach: They see this as a classic example of government overreach, finalized in the waning days of the Biden administration without proper consideration for the nuances of DeFi. Chilling Innovation: Industry experts fear that such regulations, if poorly designed, can stifle innovation and push DeFi activities overseas, hurting the US’s position in the global crypto landscape. Decoding the Controversial IRS DeFi Rule: What’s the Fuss About? At the heart of this conflict is the IRS ‘s finalized rule that mandates IRS DeFi rule for brokers involved in digital asset sales. This rule, slated to take effect after January 1, 2027, requires these brokers to report gross revenue from digital asset transactions. Sounds straightforward, right? Not so fast. The problem lies in the definition of a ‘broker’ and how it applies to the decentralized nature of DeFi. In traditional finance, brokers are intermediaries who facilitate transactions. But DeFi is built on the principle of removing intermediaries. So, who exactly is a ‘broker’ in the context of decentralized exchanges (DEXs), automated market makers (AMMs), and other DeFi protocols? This ambiguity is precisely what’s causing concern. The Blockchain Association and many in the crypto community fear that the IRS’s broad definition could inadvertently capture: Decentralized Exchanges (DEXs): Platforms like Uniswap or SushiSwap, which are governed by code and community, not centralized entities. Protocol Developers: Individuals or teams who create and maintain DeFi protocols, potentially holding them responsible for user tax reporting. Even Individual Users: In some interpretations, users interacting directly with DeFi protocols could be seen as ‘brokers’ in certain scenarios, creating an impossible compliance burden. The implications are vast and potentially crippling for the burgeoning DeFi sector. Imagine if every DEX had to collect and report detailed transaction data on all its users to the IRS. The technical and logistical nightmare is compounded by the privacy concerns inherent in DeFi. Why is DeFi Regulation So Critical and Complex? DeFi regulation is not just about taxes; it’s about striking a delicate balance between fostering innovation and protecting consumers and the integrity of the financial system. The challenge is that DeFi operates in a fundamentally different way from traditional finance. Here’s why regulating it is so complex: Aspect Traditional Finance Decentralized Finance (DeFi) Intermediaries Centralized brokers, banks, exchanges Decentralized protocols, smart contracts, AMMs Control Centralized control by institutions Decentralized governance, community-driven Transparency Opaque systems, limited transparency Transparent blockchains, open-source code Regulation Established regulatory frameworks Evolving regulatory landscape, jurisdictional challenges Traditional regulatory frameworks are often ill-equipped to handle the decentralized, borderless, and code-driven nature of DeFi. Applying old rules to new paradigms can lead to unintended consequences, like the Blockchain Association argues is happening with this IRS rule. A key concern is that overly broad or poorly designed regulations can: Stifle Innovation: Crushing the entrepreneurial spirit and slowing down the development of groundbreaking financial technologies. Drive Activity Offshore: Pushing DeFi innovation and economic activity to jurisdictions with more favorable regulatory environments, weakening the US’s competitive edge. Hurt Retail Users: Increasing compliance costs and complexities, potentially making DeFi less accessible and more expensive for everyday users. The Potential Impact on Crypto Tax Reporting and Users The implications of the crypto tax reporting rule are far-reaching. If the IRS rule stands as it is, it could create a compliance nightmare for the DeFi industry and its users. Imagine the complexity of a user engaging with multiple DeFi protocols across different chains. Tracking every transaction, calculating taxable events, and reporting them accurately could become an overwhelming burden. Here’s a glimpse of the potential ripple effects: Increased Compliance Costs: DeFi platforms may need to invest heavily in developing complex reporting systems to comply with the IRS rule, potentially passing these costs on to users. Data Privacy Concerns: Forcing DeFi protocols to collect and report user data could clash with the privacy-centric ethos of many crypto users and potentially expose sensitive information. Reduced DeFi Adoption: The added complexity and compliance burden could deter new users from entering the DeFi space, slowing down its growth and mainstream adoption. Innovation Slowdown: Resources and energy diverted to compliance could mean less investment in developing new and innovative DeFi products and services. For individual users, this could translate to more complicated tax filings, potential penalties for non-compliance (even if unintentional), and a less user-friendly DeFi experience overall. It’s crucial that any regulatory framework for DeFi is practical, proportionate, and takes into account the unique characteristics of this technology. What’s Next? The Fight for Digital Asset Tax Clarity The fight over this IRS rule is far from over. With Senator Ted Cruz introducing a bill to repeal it and the Blockchain Association actively lobbying Congress, the debate is heating up. This is a pivotal moment for the future of digital asset tax policy in the US. Here’s what to watch out for: Congressional Action: Keep an eye on whether Senator Cruz’s bill gains traction and support in Congress. The outcome of this legislative effort will be crucial. IRS Response: Will the IRS reconsider its approach in light of industry concerns? There’s a possibility they might issue further guidance or amend the rule. Industry Advocacy: The Blockchain Association and other crypto advocacy groups will continue to push for a more sensible and practical regulatory framework for DeFi. Global Developments: How other countries are regulating DeFi will also play a role, potentially influencing the US approach. The crypto community needs to stay informed and engaged in this process. The future of DeFi innovation and adoption in the US hinges on finding a regulatory balance that fosters growth while addressing legitimate concerns. This IRS rule, in its current form, appears to be a step in the wrong direction, and the Blockchain Association is right to challenge it. Conclusion: A Critical Juncture for DeFi’s Future The Blockchain Association’s urgent call to repeal the IRS’s DeFi broker revenue reporting rule highlights a critical juncture for the future of decentralized finance. This isn’t just a technical tax issue; it’s a fundamental question of how innovation will be regulated in the digital age. A poorly conceived rule could stifle the immense potential of DeFi, pushing development and economic activity overseas and hindering the US’s leadership in this transformative technology. The fight for sensible DeFi regulation is essential. It requires collaboration between regulators, industry experts, and policymakers to create frameworks that are both effective and innovation-friendly. The outcome of this battle will not only shape the future of DeFi but also set a precedent for how emerging technologies are regulated in the years to come. Stay tuned – this is a story that’s still unfolding, and its impact will be felt across the entire crypto landscape. title: Groundbreaking Nasdaq Proposal: Unlocking Digital Asset Investments with New Crypto ETF Rule
body: Exciting news for crypto enthusiasts and investors! Nasdaq, a leading global exchange, is pushing the boundaries of digital asset accessibility. They’ve just proposed a rule change that could pave the way for a new era of investment opportunities in the crypto space. If you’ve been waiting for more regulated and mainstream avenues to engage with digital assets, this could be a game-changer. Let’s dive into the details of this potentially transformative development. What’s the Buzz Around Digital Asset Investments on Nasdaq? Nasdaq has formally submitted a proposal to the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) to introduce Rule 5712. This isn’t just another procedural step; it’s a significant move aimed at creating a clear regulatory framework for listing and trading investment products based on digital asset investments . Think of it as Nasdaq laying down the welcome mat for a wider range of crypto-related investment vehicles. Here’s a breakdown of what this proposal entails: New Rule 5712: This rule is specifically designed to govern the listing of ‘digital asset-based investment interests.’ This broad category includes securities backed by digital assets and commodity-based products that have a crypto foundation. Expanding Investment Options: The rule is intended to open doors for investors to access digital assets through familiar investment structures, potentially reducing some of the perceived barriers to entry in the crypto market. Hashdex Nasdaq Crypto Index U.S. ETF in Focus: The proposal explicitly mentions moving the Hashdex Nasdaq Crypto Index U.S. ETF under this new rule. This ETF is already invested in leading cryptocurrencies like Bitcoin and Ethereum, signaling Nasdaq’s readiness to embrace established digital assets. Future-Proofing for Crypto Evolution: The ETF’s structure is designed to be adaptable. As U.S. SEC crypto regulations evolve and mature, the ETF has the flexibility to potentially include a broader spectrum of digital assets. This forward-thinking approach is crucial in the rapidly changing crypto landscape. Why is a Dedicated Crypto ETF Rule a Big Deal? The introduction of Rule 5712 isn’t just a minor adjustment; it represents a significant step forward for the integration of crypto ETFs into mainstream finance. Here’s why this proposal is garnering attention: Increased Legitimacy and Investor Confidence: Having a dedicated rule within a major exchange like Nasdaq lends significant legitimacy to the digital asset space. This can boost investor confidence, particularly for institutional investors who often require a clear regulatory framework. Simplified Access to Crypto Markets: For many investors, directly buying and managing cryptocurrencies can seem complex and risky. Crypto ETFs offered through established exchanges like Nasdaq simplify this process. Investors can gain exposure to digital assets through brokerage accounts they already use for stocks and traditional ETFs. Potential for Broader Market Participation: By making it easier and more regulated to invest in digital assets, Nasdaq’s proposal could attract a wider range of investors. This influx of capital could further mature the crypto market and reduce volatility over time. Clarity in Regulatory Landscape: The proposal signals a proactive approach from a major exchange in navigating the evolving SEC crypto regulations . This clarity is crucial for businesses looking to build and offer digital asset investment products within a compliant framework. Navigating the Challenges and Looking Ahead for Nasdaq Crypto ETFs While the proposal is undoubtedly exciting, it’s important to acknowledge the potential challenges and the road ahead for Nasdaq crypto initiatives and the broader crypto ETF market. Potential Challenges: Challenge Description SEC Approval Process: The SEC’s approval of Rule 5712 is not guaranteed. The SEC has been cautious about crypto-related investment products in the past, and the review process could be lengthy and involve requests for modifications. Regulatory Uncertainty: The broader regulatory landscape for digital assets in the U.S. is still evolving. Changes in regulations could impact the types of digital assets that can be included in ETFs and the operational requirements for these products. Market Volatility: The cryptocurrency market is known for its volatility. While ETFs can offer diversification, they are still subject to the inherent price swings of the underlying digital assets, such as Bitcoin and Ethereum. Education and Adoption: Widespread adoption of crypto ETFs will require ongoing investor education. Many investors are still unfamiliar with digital assets and their risks and potential rewards. Actionable Insights and What to Watch For: Monitor SEC Filings: Keep an eye on the SEC website for updates on the review of Nasdaq’s Rule 5712 proposal. Public comments and SEC responses can provide insights into the likely outcome and timeline. Track Hashdex ETF Performance: The Hashdex Nasdaq Crypto Index U.S. ETF will be a key indicator of investor interest in these types of products. Monitor its trading volume and asset growth. Stay Informed on Regulatory Developments: Follow news and analysis related to SEC crypto regulations and broader digital asset policy in the U.S. This will help you understand the evolving landscape and potential impacts on crypto investments. Educate Yourself on Crypto ETFs: If you are considering investing in crypto ETFs, take the time to understand how they work, their potential risks and rewards, and how they fit into your overall investment strategy. The Future Looks Bright for Bitcoin ETF and Beyond Nasdaq’s proposal to introduce Rule 5712 is a bold and promising step towards integrating Bitcoin ETF and other digital asset investments into mainstream financial markets. While regulatory hurdles and market volatility remain factors to consider, this initiative signals a growing acceptance and maturity of the crypto space within traditional finance. For investors seeking regulated and accessible ways to participate in the digital asset revolution, this development is undoubtedly one to watch closely. The potential unlocking of new investment avenues and the increased legitimacy that comes with exchange-listed products could mark a pivotal moment for the future of crypto investing. To learn more about the latest crypto market trends, explore our article on key developments shaping Bitcoin price action.

title: Strategy prices $2B convertible senior notes offering
body: Strategy (NASDAQ: MSTR ) announced the pricing of $2B aggregate principal amount of its 0% convertible senior notes due 2030 in a private offering. The initial purchasers of the notes have the option to buy up to an additional $300M in notes within five business days of the first issuance. The notes will not bear regular interest, and the principal amount of the notes will not accrete. The offering is expected to close on February 21, 2025. The notes will mature on March 1, 2030, unless earlier repurchased, redeemed or converted. Before December 3, 2029, noteholders will have the right to convert their notes only upon the occurrence of certain events. Strategy estimates that the net proceeds from the offering will be ~$1.99B. Strategy intends to use the net proceeds from this offering for general corporate purposes, including the acquisition of bitcoin, and for working capital. MSTR shares rose 1.5% premarket on Thursday. Source: Press release More on Strategy Strategy: It Just Doesn't Make Sense What A Strategy! title: Truth Revealed: Vitalik Buterin Declares Ethereum a Decentralized Ecosystem, Not a Company
body: In a candid statement that has resonated throughout the crypto sphere, Ethereum’s co-founder, Vitalik Buterin, has firmly reiterated a core tenet of the project’s philosophy: Ethereum is a decentralized ecosystem , emphatically not a company. This declaration, made on WarpCast, arrives at a crucial juncture for the world’s second-largest cryptocurrency, as it navigates an evolving landscape of regulations, technological advancements, and ever-increasing user expectations. But what does this distinction truly mean for Ethereum, its users, and the future of blockchain technology? Let’s dive deep into Buterin’s insightful perspective and unpack the implications. Why Ethereum’s Decentralized Ecosystem Matters More Than Ever Buterin’s assertion isn’t just semantics; it’s a fundamental principle that underpins the very essence of Ethereum. He highlights the presence of numerous significant entities within the Ethereum space – giants like ConsenSys and Coinbase – yet stresses that these are participants in a broader, decentralized network, not components of a centralized corporate structure. The core message is clear: Ethereum’s strength lies in its distributed nature, fostering innovation and resilience far beyond the capabilities of a traditional company. Consider these key aspects: Resilience Against Central Points of Failure: Unlike companies that can be shut down or controlled by a single authority, a decentralized ecosystem like Ethereum distributes power across numerous nodes and participants. This inherent distribution makes it incredibly resistant to censorship, shutdowns, and single points of failure. Open Innovation and Collaboration: The decentralized nature of Ethereum encourages open-source development and collaborative innovation. Anyone can build upon and contribute to the ecosystem, leading to a diverse range of applications and solutions that wouldn’t be possible within a closed corporate environment. Community-Driven Governance: While the Ethereum Foundation plays a coordinating role, the overall direction of Ethereum is influenced by a vast and diverse community. This community-driven governance model ensures that the platform evolves in a way that benefits its users and aligns with the principles of decentralization. Global Accessibility and Inclusivity: Ethereum’s decentralized nature makes it accessible to anyone, anywhere in the world, without needing permission from a central authority. This inclusivity fosters a global community of developers, users, and innovators, driving growth and adoption. Vitalik Buterin’s Vision: Applications Over Infrastructure Buterin further elaborated on the current phase of Ethereum’s development, stating, “now is the era of applications, not infrastructure.” This statement marks a significant shift in focus. In its early years, much of Ethereum’s energy was directed towards building the foundational infrastructure – the blockchain itself, smart contract capabilities, and network security. Now, with a robust infrastructure in place, the emphasis is rightly shifting towards leveraging this foundation to create impactful and user-friendly applications. This transition is crucial for several reasons: Real-World Utility: Focusing on applications means translating the potential of blockchain technology into tangible solutions that address real-world problems. This could range from decentralized finance (DeFi) applications to supply chain management solutions, identity verification systems, and beyond. User Adoption and Engagement: Applications are the interface through which most users will interact with blockchain technology. By prioritizing user-friendly and valuable applications, Ethereum can attract a wider audience and drive mainstream adoption of decentralized technologies. Ecosystem Growth and Sustainability: A thriving application ecosystem creates a positive feedback loop. Successful applications attract more users, developers, and investment, further fueling the growth and sustainability of the entire Ethereum network. Demonstrating the Power of Decentralization: Compelling applications showcase the practical benefits of a decentralized ecosystem . They provide concrete examples of how decentralization can lead to greater transparency, security, efficiency, and user empowerment compared to traditional centralized systems. The Call for New Ecosystem Inflow: Expanding the Ethereum Universe Buterin’s comments also included a call for “more opportunities to be provided to create new ecosystem inflow.” This is a forward-looking statement that acknowledges the need for continuous growth and evolution within the Ethereum ecosystem. Ecosystem inflow refers to the influx of new users, developers, projects, and capital into the network. Sustained inflow is vital for maintaining the dynamism and competitiveness of Ethereum. How can we foster this inflow and ensure the continued vibrancy of the Ethereum decentralized ecosystem ? Improving User Experience (UX): One of the biggest barriers to entry for new users is the complexity often associated with blockchain technology. Simplifying user interfaces, streamlining onboarding processes, and providing better educational resources are crucial steps to attract a broader audience. Developer Tooling and Support: Attracting and retaining developers is essential for building a thriving application ecosystem. Investing in robust developer tooling, providing comprehensive documentation, and offering strong community support can make Ethereum a more attractive platform for developers. Interoperability and Cross-Chain Collaboration: The future of blockchain is likely to be multi-chain. Enhancing interoperability between Ethereum and other blockchains can unlock new opportunities for collaboration and innovation, expanding the reach and utility of the Ethereum ecosystem. Focus on Emerging Markets: Emerging markets represent a significant growth opportunity for the crypto space. Tailoring solutions and outreach efforts to the specific needs and contexts of these markets can unlock new user bases and drive global adoption of Ethereum. Challenges and Considerations for a Decentralized Future While the vision of a decentralized ecosystem is compelling, it’s essential to acknowledge the challenges and considerations that come with it. Decentralization is not a panacea, and it presents its own set of complexities: Challenge Description Consideration Governance Complexity Decentralized governance can be slower and more complex than centralized decision-making. Reaching consensus across a diverse community can be challenging. Developing effective and efficient decentralized governance models is an ongoing area of research and development within the Ethereum ecosystem. Scalability While Ethereum has made significant strides with upgrades like The Merge, scalability remains a key challenge for widespread adoption. Layer-2 scaling solutions and ongoing research into Layer-1 improvements are crucial for addressing scalability and ensuring Ethereum can handle increasing transaction volumes. Regulation The regulatory landscape for cryptocurrencies is still evolving globally. Navigating this complex and often uncertain environment is a challenge for the entire crypto industry, including Ethereum. Proactive engagement with regulators and a commitment to compliance are essential for fostering a sustainable and regulated crypto ecosystem. Security While blockchain technology itself is inherently secure, vulnerabilities can still exist in smart contracts and applications built on top of it. Rigorous security audits, best practices for smart contract development, and ongoing vigilance are crucial for maintaining the security and integrity of the Ethereum ecosystem. Actionable Insights: Embracing the Decentralized Ethos For those involved in the crypto space – developers, users, investors, and enthusiasts – Buterin’s message offers valuable actionable insights: Support Decentralized Projects: Actively seek out and support projects that align with the principles of decentralization. This includes contributing to open-source initiatives, participating in decentralized governance, and using decentralized applications. Focus on User-Centric Applications: Developers should prioritize building applications that are user-friendly, solve real-world problems, and enhance the overall user experience within the Ethereum ecosystem. Educate and Advocate for Decentralization: Spread awareness about the benefits of decentralization and advocate for policies that support the growth of decentralized technologies. Education is key to driving wider adoption and understanding. Contribute to Ecosystem Growth: Actively participate in the Ethereum community, contribute to discussions, provide feedback, and support initiatives that aim to expand the ecosystem and attract new participants. Conclusion: Ethereum’s Decentralized Promise Vitalik Buterin’s reaffirmation of Ethereum as a decentralized ecosystem is more than just a statement; it’s a guiding principle that continues to shape the project’s trajectory. By emphasizing decentralization and shifting focus towards applications, Ethereum is poised to unlock its full potential and drive the next wave of innovation in the blockchain space. The challenges are real, but the promise of a more open, transparent, and user-empowered future, built on the foundation of a decentralized ecosystem, remains incredibly powerful and inspiring. As we move forward, embracing this decentralized ethos will be crucial for realizing the transformative potential of Ethereum and the broader crypto revolution. To learn more about the latest Ethereum trends, explore our article on key developments shaping Ethereum price action.

title: Astonishing Kraken Survey: 85% of US Crypto Holders Invest in Memecoins – Unveiling the Crypto Phenomenon
body: Hold onto your hats, crypto enthusiasts! The latest buzz in the digital currency world isn’t about Bitcoin’s next halving or Ethereum’s upgrades, but something far more… shall we say, meme-orable . A recent Kraken survey has dropped a bombshell: a staggering 85% of U.S. crypto holders have ventured into the wild world of memecoins. Yes, you read that right. Despite the rollercoaster reputation of these digital assets, a vast majority of American crypto investors are taking the plunge. Let’s dive deep into what’s fueling this fascination and what it means for the future of crypto investment. The Allure of Memecoins: Why Are US Crypto Holders Hooked? Memecoins, born from internet jokes and viral trends, has carved a significant niche in the cryptocurrency market. But what exactly is drawing 85% of US crypto holders into their orbit? The Kraken survey sheds light on some compelling reasons: High Reward Potential: A whopping 76% of respondents believe the potential rewards of memecoins justify the inherent risks. The stories of overnight millionaires from Dogecoin and Shiba Inu are hard to ignore, fueling the hope for similar exponential gains. Market Credibility (Surprisingly!): An unexpected 44% think memecoins will actually improve the credibility of the cryptocurrency market. This might seem counterintuitive, but perhaps investors see memecoins as a gateway for wider adoption, bringing in new demographics and injecting fresh capital into the crypto space. Expected Outperformance: Another 42% anticipate memecoins will outperform other cryptocurrencies this year. This bullish outlook suggests a belief in the continued virality and community-driven growth of these tokens. Short-Term Gains: For 29%, the memecoin game is about quick profits. The volatile nature of memecoins allows for rapid price swings, creating opportunities for savvy traders to capitalize on short-term pumps. Diversification Strategy: And finally, 23% are using memecoins as a diversification tool within their broader crypto investment portfolios. In the world of crypto, diversification is key, and memecoins, despite their risk profile, offer a unique asset class to spread investments across. Navigating the Cryptocurrency Risk Landscape of Memecoins While the allure of memecoins is undeniable, it’s crucial to acknowledge the elephant in the room: cryptocurrency risk . Memecoins are notorious for their extreme volatility. Prices can skyrocket based on social media hype and celebrity endorsements, but they can also plummet just as quickly, leaving investors with significant losses. This inherent volatility stems from several factors: Lack of Fundamental Value: Unlike established cryptocurrencies like Bitcoin or Ethereum, which have underlying technology and real-world use cases, memecoins often lack fundamental value. Their price is primarily driven by community sentiment and speculation. Whale Manipulation: The relatively low market capitalization of many memecoins makes them susceptible to manipulation by large holders (whales). A few large sell orders can trigger massive price drops. Hype-Driven Markets: Memecoin prices are heavily influenced by social media trends and online communities. This hype can be fleeting, leading to unsustainable price bubbles. Rug Pull Potential: In the darker corners of the memecoin world, the risk of “rug pulls” is ever-present. This is where developers abandon a project after raising significant funds, leaving investors with worthless tokens. Kraken Survey Insights: Are Memecoins a Wise Crypto Investment? The Kraken survey data paints a fascinating picture. On one hand, it highlights the widespread adoption of memecoins among crypto holders and the strong belief in their potential. On the other hand, it’s crucial to approach memecoin crypto investment with caution and a clear understanding of the risks involved. Here are some actionable insights based on the survey findings: Educate Yourself: Before diving into memecoins, thoroughly research the specific tokens you’re interested in. Understand their communities, development teams (if any), and market dynamics. Risk Management is Key: Never invest more than you can afford to lose in memecoins. Given their volatility, consider them a high-risk, high-reward asset class. Diversify Your Portfolio: Don’t put all your eggs in the memecoin basket. Diversify your crypto investment portfolio across different asset classes to mitigate risk. Be Aware of Hype Cycles: Recognize that memecoin prices are often driven by hype. Be wary of investing at the peak of a hype cycle, and consider taking profits when prices surge. Long-Term vs. Short-Term Strategy: Decide whether you’re investing in memecoins for short-term gains or a longer-term play. Short-term trading requires active monitoring and quick decision-making, while long-term holding in the memecoin space is exceptionally speculative. Examples of Memecoin Success and Cautionary Tales The memecoin landscape is filled with both success stories and cautionary tales. Dogecoin (DOGE) and Shiba Inu (SHIB) stand out as prime examples of memecoins that defied expectations, achieving massive market capitalizations and creating fortunes for early investors. Their success was largely fueled by strong communities and viral social media campaigns. However, for every DOGE and SHIB, there are countless memecoins that have faded into obscurity or have been outright scams. Many memecoins experience a brief period of hype followed by a dramatic crash, leaving investors holding worthless tokens. It’s essential to remember that the memecoin market is highly speculative and unpredictable. The Future of Memecoins and Crypto Investment Trends The Kraken survey unequivocally demonstrates that memecoins are not just a fleeting trend; they are a significant part of the current crypto investment landscape. Whether they will continue to thrive and evolve or eventually fade away remains to be seen. Several factors will likely shape their future: Mainstream Adoption: If memecoins gain wider acceptance and integration into mainstream financial systems, their legitimacy and longevity could increase. Technological Innovation: Memecoin projects that incorporate utility or innovative technologies beyond just being a meme might have a better chance of long-term survival. Regulatory Scrutiny: Increased regulatory attention on the cryptocurrency market, including memecoins, could impact their accessibility and growth. Community Evolution: The strength and evolution of memecoin communities will continue to be a crucial factor in their success. Conclusion: Embracing the Memecoin Mania with Caution The Kraken survey’s revelation that 85% of US crypto holders are investing in memecoins is truly astonishing . It underscores the powerful appeal of these unconventional digital assets and the evolving nature of crypto investment . While the potential for explosive gains is undeniably seductive, it’s paramount to approach memecoins with a healthy dose of skepticism and a robust risk management strategy. The memecoin market is a wild ride, offering both incredible opportunities and significant dangers. For those willing to navigate its volatility with prudence and knowledge, it can be an exciting, albeit risky, frontier in the world of cryptocurrency. To learn more about the latest crypto market trends, explore our article on key developments shaping Bitcoin price action.

title: Soaring Crypto App Downloads in UAE: A 41% Surge Signals Massive Adoption in 2024
body: Buckle up, crypto enthusiasts in the UAE! The digital currency revolution is gaining serious momentum in the Emirates, and the latest data is nothing short of electrifying. Imagine this: a whopping 41% year-on-year increase in crypto app downloads in 2024! Yes, you read that right. The appetite for digital assets in the UAE is clearly exploding, and we’ve got the inside scoop on what’s fueling this incredible growth. Let’s dive deep into the numbers and explore what this surge in crypto app downloads means for the future of digital finance in the region. Unpacking the Astonishing 41% Surge in Crypto App Downloads According to a recent report by Cointelegraph, citing data from the app analytics gurus at AppsFlyer, the UAE’s crypto app scene is booming. This isn’t just a slight uptick; it’s a dramatic 41% leap in crypto app downloads compared to the previous year. Think about it – that’s a massive influx of new users stepping into the world of digital currencies right from their smartphones. What’s even more fascinating is the timing of this surge. Here’s a breakdown of the key periods: Second Half of 2023: This period marked the lion’s share of the download activity. Q4 2023 (October-December): Get ready for this – over 1 million downloads per month ! That’s a sustained period of intense interest and adoption, suggesting a fundamental shift in how people in the UAE are engaging with crypto. This data paints a vivid picture: the UAE is rapidly becoming a hotbed for crypto adoption. But what’s driving this phenomenal growth? Let’s explore the key factors. Decoding the Drivers Behind UAE’s Crypto Adoption Spree AppsFlyer points to a couple of significant catalysts behind this impressive surge in UAE crypto adoption . Let’s break them down: 1. The Trump Effect: A Pro-Crypto Presidential Stance? Yes, you read that correctly. Former U.S. President Donald Trump’s increasingly pro-crypto rhetoric is cited as a contributing factor. While it might seem surprising, global crypto markets are highly sensitive to regulatory signals and the overall sentiment from major world leaders. Trump’s shift towards a more favorable stance on cryptocurrencies could be interpreted as a positive sign for the industry’s future, potentially encouraging more people to explore and invest in digital assets. This perceived validation from a prominent political figure can indeed influence market sentiment and drive adoption, even in regions far from the US. 2. Aggressive Marketing by Crypto Apps: Getting the Word Out The crypto app industry is fiercely competitive, and companies are pulling out all the stops to attract new users. AppsFlyer highlights “aggressive marketing efforts” as another major driver. Think about it – you’re seeing more crypto ads online, on social media, and maybe even on billboards. These marketing blitzes are designed to educate, entice, and ultimately convert curious individuals into active crypto users. This combined with increased media coverage and general buzz around cryptocurrencies creates a powerful wave of interest. [img src=”image-placeholder.jpg” alt=”Crypto app downloads in UAE surge”] Why the UAE is Ripe for Crypto Growth: A Fertile Ground Beyond these specific triggers, the UAE, particularly cities like Dubai, offer a particularly fertile ground for cryptocurrency UAE adoption. Several factors contribute to this: Tech-Savvy Population: The UAE boasts a young, digitally native population that is generally quick to adopt new technologies. Smartphones are ubiquitous, and online financial services are widely used. Pro-Innovation Government: The UAE government has actively positioned itself as a hub for innovation and future technologies. They’ve shown a willingness to explore and regulate the crypto space, rather than outright banning it. This regulatory clarity (or at least a move towards it) fosters confidence and attracts investment. Financial Hub Status: Dubai, in particular, is a major international financial center. This attracts a global workforce and sophisticated investors who are already familiar with and interested in alternative investments like cryptocurrencies. High Smartphone Penetration: Access to smartphones and reliable internet is crucial for app-based crypto adoption. The UAE has extremely high smartphone penetration rates, making it easy for people to access and use crypto apps. Benefits of Increased Crypto App Adoption in the UAE This surge in crypto apps usage isn’t just about numbers; it has real-world implications and potential benefits for the UAE economy and its residents: Financial Inclusion: Crypto apps can provide access to financial services for individuals who may be underserved by traditional banking systems. Economic Diversification: Embracing the crypto industry can further diversify the UAE economy beyond oil and gas, creating new jobs and attracting foreign investment. Technological Advancement: Increased crypto adoption fosters innovation in related technologies like blockchain and fintech, positioning the UAE at the forefront of the digital economy. Remittance Efficiency: Cryptocurrencies can offer faster and cheaper ways to send and receive remittances, which is particularly relevant in a country with a large expatriate population. Navigating the Challenges: Roadblocks to Consider While the growth is exciting, it’s crucial to acknowledge the challenges that come with rapid UAE crypto market expansion: Regulatory Uncertainty: While the UAE is becoming more crypto-friendly, the regulatory landscape is still evolving. Clear and comprehensive regulations are needed to protect consumers and businesses while fostering innovation. Security Concerns: As more people use crypto apps, security becomes paramount. Protecting users from scams, hacks, and fraud is a critical challenge. User education and robust security measures are essential. Market Volatility: Cryptocurrencies are known for their price volatility. New users may be unprepared for these fluctuations, potentially leading to financial risks. Responsible education about risk management is vital. Education Gap: While adoption is growing, a significant portion of the population may still lack a deep understanding of cryptocurrencies and blockchain technology. Bridging this education gap is crucial for sustainable and responsible growth. Actionable Insights: What Does This Mean for You? So, what can we take away from this crypto app downloads boom in the UAE? For Individuals: If you’ve been crypto-curious, now might be the time to explore reputable crypto apps. However, always do your research, understand the risks involved, and start with small amounts. Educate yourself about crypto security best practices. For Businesses: The UAE crypto market is clearly expanding. Businesses should consider how they can leverage crypto and blockchain technologies to enhance their operations, reach new customers, or offer innovative financial solutions. For Regulators: This growth underscores the need for proactive and balanced regulation. Focus on fostering innovation while protecting consumers and ensuring market integrity. International collaboration on crypto regulation is also increasingly important. Conclusion: UAE Embraces the Crypto Future The 41% surge in crypto app downloads in the UAE is more than just a statistic; it’s a powerful signal. It indicates a growing embrace of digital currencies and a willingness to participate in the evolving global crypto landscape. Fueled by factors like pro-crypto sentiment and aggressive marketing, and supported by the UAE’s conducive environment, this trend is likely to continue. While challenges remain, the potential benefits for the UAE economy and its citizens are immense. The crypto revolution in the UAE is not just coming – it’s already here, and it’s accelerating. To learn more about the latest crypto market trends, explore our article on key developments shaping Bitcoin price action.

title: Vitalik Buterin Makes Bold Statements About Bitcoin (BTC) and Ethereum (ETH)! "Just Two…"
body: There are many projects in the cryptocurrency market. While it is very important to determine which project is long-lasting and solid when investing, Ethereum co-founder Vitalik Buterin explained his thoughts on this subject. Only Bitcoin and Ethereum Can Survive! On WarpCast, Vitalik Buterin argued that only Bitcoin and Ethereum have the essential property needed for long-term survival. Claiming that only Bitcoin and Ethereum can survive without foundations at this point, Buterin stated that only BTC and ETH have true decentralization features. “True decentralization can be tested by whether a blockchain can survive without a foundation. And at this point, only Bitcoin and Ethereum can confidently meet that standard.” According to Buterin, while Ethereum appears to be more obviously centralized than Bitcoin, ETH has also made significant strides in decentralization. At this point, Buterin emphasized that most of Ethereum's development now occurs outside of the Ethereum Foundation. “Most of Ethereum development happens outside of the foundation, with independent client teams and researchers. The Ethereum community is a large and globally distributed community that includes developers, users, stakers, and researchers. This broad participation ensures that the network is not managed centrally by a single entity. Additionally, Ethereum’s transition to Proof of Stake further enhances decentralization by reducing reliance on energy-intensive mining and opening up network participation to a wider range of users through staking.” The Allegations About Ethereum Saddened Me! In another statement, Vitalik Buterin criticized the intolerant claims made for Ethereum. Buterin expressed his disappointment in claims that Ethereum is intolerant of gambling-related practices like other blockchains. Speaking to questions at Tako’s AMA session, Buterin stated that he has no interest in participating in a blockchain if the blockchain community embraces such distorted ethics. “Perhaps the most disappointing thing for me lately has been some people saying that Ethereum is not good and that it is intolerant. Because we don't have enough respect for casinos on the blockchain and other chains are happy to accept any application, so they are better. “If the blockchain community has such moral issues, I have no interest in participating in blockchain. Ethereum needs to work together to create the world we want to see.” *This is not investment advice. Continue Reading: Vitalik Buterin Makes Bold Statements About Bitcoin (BTC) and Ethereum (ETH)! "Just Two…"

title: Fearless Bitcoin Bull Cycle Prediction: CryptoQuant CEO’s ETF Outflow Alert
body: Are you wondering if the Bitcoin bull run is nearing its peak? Hold on, because a prominent crypto analyst has just dropped a bombshell prediction! CryptoQuant CEO, Ki Young Ju, believes the current Bitcoin bull cycle still has legs, but he’s watching one key indicator like a hawk: Bitcoin ETF outflows. Let’s dive into his analysis and understand what it means for the future of the crypto market. Decoding the CryptoQuant CEO’s Bitcoin Bull Cycle Prediction Ki Young Ju, the CEO of CryptoQuant, a well-known on-chain data analytics platform, recently shared his insights on X (formerly Twitter) about the ongoing Bitcoin bull cycle. His analysis centres around the demand for spot Bitcoin ETFs and how it influences market momentum. He argues that as long as demand for these ETFs remains positive overall, the bull market is likely to persist. But what exactly does this mean? Ju’s core thesis can be summarized as: Positive ETF Demand = Bull Market Continuation: As long as investors are net buyers of Bitcoin ETFs, indicating strong demand, the upward pressure on Bitcoin’s price is likely to continue. Negative ETF Demand = Potential Bear Market: Sustained net negative demand for Bitcoin ETFs, meaning more investors are selling than buying, could signal a shift towards a bear market. In essence, he’s using ETF flows as a barometer for institutional and, to some extent, retail investor sentiment towards Bitcoin. Think of it like this: ETFs are a major gateway for traditional investors to access Bitcoin. Their buying activity reflects a significant influx of capital into the Bitcoin ecosystem. Bitcoin ETF Demand: The Fuel for the Bull Run? Since the approval of spot Bitcoin ETFs in the United States in January 2024, these investment vehicles have become a crucial factor in the crypto market. They provide a regulated and accessible way for institutional and retail investors to gain exposure to Bitcoin without directly holding the cryptocurrency. The initial surge in demand for these ETFs was a major catalyst in pushing Bitcoin’s price to new all-time highs. But why are Bitcoin ETFs so important for the bull cycle? Increased Accessibility: ETFs open up Bitcoin investment to a much wider range of investors who may be hesitant to navigate the complexities of crypto exchanges and wallets. Institutional Adoption: Large institutional investors, such as pension funds and hedge funds, can allocate capital to Bitcoin through ETFs, which are often more compliant with regulatory requirements. Liquidity and Market Efficiency: ETFs enhance liquidity in the Bitcoin market and can contribute to more efficient price discovery. Positive Sentiment Indicator: Strong ETF inflows signal positive market sentiment and confidence in Bitcoin’s long-term prospects. The Significance of ETF Outflows: Watching for the Bear? While positive Bitcoin ETF demand is a bullish signal, the reverse – ETF outflows – is what the CryptoQuant CEO is keenly observing as a potential indicator of a market downturn. Why are ETF outflows so concerning? Reduced Demand: Outflows signify that investors are pulling capital out of Bitcoin ETFs, indicating weakening demand for Bitcoin exposure through this route. Price Pressure: Sustained outflows can exert downward pressure on Bitcoin’s price as ETF providers may need to sell Bitcoin to meet redemption requests. Sentiment Shift: Significant outflows could reflect a broader shift in market sentiment, potentially signaling growing fear or uncertainty about Bitcoin’s future price trajectory. Bear Market Signal?: As Ju suggests, prolonged net negative ETF demand could be a crucial sign that the bull cycle is losing steam and a bear market might be on the horizon. However, it’s important to remember that ETF flows are just one piece of the puzzle. Other factors also influence the crypto market , including macroeconomic conditions, regulatory developments, technological advancements, and overall investor sentiment across the broader financial landscape. Navigating the Crypto Market: Actionable Insights So, what can you, as a crypto enthusiast or investor, take away from the CryptoQuant CEO’s analysis? Here are some actionable insights: Monitor ETF Flows: Keep an eye on the daily and weekly net flows of Bitcoin ETFs. Several websites and crypto data providers track this data. Look for trends – are inflows consistently positive, or are outflows starting to emerge? Context is Key: Don’t solely rely on ETF flows. Consider them in conjunction with other market indicators, such as on-chain metrics, trading volume, and macroeconomic news. Stay Informed: Follow reputable crypto analysts and news sources to stay updated on market trends and potential shifts in sentiment. CryptoQuant’s insights, like those from Ki Young Ju, can be valuable, but always do your own research. Manage Risk: The crypto market is volatile. Understand your risk tolerance and invest responsibly. Diversification and proper risk management strategies are crucial, especially during periods of market uncertainty. The Road Ahead: Bull or Bear? CryptoQuant CEO’s prediction highlights the critical role of Bitcoin ETF demand in sustaining the current bull cycle. While the market remains dynamic and unpredictable, monitoring ETF flows provides a valuable tool for gauging investor sentiment and potential market direction. The coming weeks and months will be crucial in determining whether the positive ETF demand continues to fuel the bull run or if increasing outflows signal the beginning of a shift towards a bear market. Staying informed and adaptable will be key to navigating the exciting, yet volatile, world of cryptocurrency. To learn more about the latest crypto market trends, explore our article on key developments shaping Bitcoin price action.

title: Bitcoin Price Analysis: BTC Reclaims $97,000 As Markets Make Substantial Recovery
body: Bitcoin (BTC) reclaimed $97,000 during the current session as the crypto market showed signs of recovery after weeks of subdued price action. The flagship cryptocurrency is up nearly 1% and trading around $97,200 as buyers look to push it beyond the 20-day SMA. BTC’s recovery comes after it fell to an intraday low of $93,437 on Tuesday. The recovery can be attributed to a positive meeting between Donald Trump and Vladimir Putin and the announcement of diplomatic relations between the two countries. BTC Can Remain Bullish Even After 30% Drop According to CryptoQuant CEO Ki Young Ju, Bitcoin (BTC) can drop to $77,000 and maintain its bull market in 2025. Ju suggested a 30% drop would keep the current uptrend at par with historical norms. According to Ju, Bitcoin remains in a bull cycle despite a month of sideways price action and an inability to reclaim $100,000. Despite this, higher levels will persist through the remainder of the year despite its recent sluggishness. Ju stated, “I don’t think we’ll enter a bear market this year. We’re still in a bull cycle. The price would eventually go up, but the range seems broad. I personally think that the bull cycle could continue even with a -30% dip from ATH (e.g., 110K → 77K), as seen in past cycles.” A drop to $77,000 would keep BTC above its previous cycle’s all-time high. The level has become a popular target for traders who want to see the market form a solid support base. Additionally, a CryptoQuant analyst believes BTC was due more price upside during the cycle. The analyst stated that since its halving, BTC has registered a growth of just 60%. “Despite the continuing halving cycle, I’d expect to see a sell in May effect, a sideways summer, and elevated price levels by the last quarter. The positive Q4 seasonality has been repeated in 2013, 2016, 2017, 2020, 2021, 2023, and 2024. A deeper correction could be multiple months or even a year away.” Bitwise Announces Donation To Support Bitcoin’s Open Source Development Asset management firm Bitwise has announced a $150,000 donation to help support Bitcoin’s open-source development. The donation aims to help strengthen the network’s security and boost innovation. The move is part of Bitwise’s commitment to allocate 10% of its gross profits towards charitable causes. The funds will be distributed across three non-profit organizations: Open Sats, Bitcoin Brink, and the Human Rights Foundation (HRF). According to Bitwise, the entities play a crucial role in the Bitcoin ecosystem, promoting decentralized growth and technological advancements. “Today, Bitwise is donating $150,000 to support Bitcoin open-source developers, who work tirelessly to secure and maintain the network. When the Bitwise Bitcoin ETF ($BITB) launched, we committed to donating 10% of its gross profits each year. We’re delighted to make good on that.” Bitcoin To Reach $200,000 In 2025: Anthony Scaramucci Anthony Scaramucci has predicted BTC will surge to $200,000 in 2025, with a potential strategic Bitcoin reserve in the pipeline. Scaramucci made the predictions in an interview, emphasizing that for BTC to establish itself as an asset class, it must reach a market cap of $15-20 trillion. He also discussed Donald Trump’s plans for a strategic Bitcoin reserve, adding that bipartisan support is needed for its approval. However, he was critical of Trump’s involvement in crypto, calling it a distraction from positive regulatory developments. Bitcoin (BTC) Price Analysis Bitcoin (BTC)’s recovery is gaining strength as it inches past $97,500. If BTC can move past $97,500 and $98,000, it opens the door for a move towards $100,000. The price dipped below a key level on February 18. However, it recovered thanks to buying activity at lower levels. BTC was trading in a narrow range last week and registered a substantial recovery on Wednesday after dropping to an intraday low of $94,118, rebounding from this level to register an increase of 2.17% and settle at $97,881. Sellers were back in control on Thursday as BTC dropped 1.24% to an intraday low of $95,315 before settling at $96,663. Buyers attempted a move past the 50-day SMA on Friday as BTC reached an intraday high of $98,929. However, it could not stay at this level and ultimately settled at $97,566 after an increase of almost 1%. Buyers retained control on Saturday, and BTC registered a marginal increase to settle at $97,705. Source: TradingView Sentiment changed on Sunday as BTC dropped 1.51% and settled at $96,225. Sellers retained control on Monday as the price fell 0.48% to $95,767. BTC plunged to an intraday low of $93,430 on Tuesday as selling pressure intensified. However, BTC recovered from this level to reclaim $95,000 and settle at $95,634, ultimately registering a marginal decline. Buyers returned to the market on Wednesday, and BTC rose 0.79% to $96,386. The current session sees BTC up over 1% and trading above $97,500 as it looks to push above $98,000. BTC bulls had not ceded much ground to the bears prior to this week's jump. While indicators were heavily bearish, the recent recovery has seen the RSI move to the verge of moving past the neutral zone. If it is rejected at this level, it would indicate bears still have the upper hand. BTC must reclaim $98,000 and $100,000 for bullish sentiment to return. A break above these levels could set the flagship currency up for a move to $105,000. On the other hand, if sellers retake control, BTC could plunge to $90,000. Buyers are expected to defend this level because a break below it will complete a double-top pattern, leading to a deeper correction. title: Swiss-regulated Sygnum Bank weighs in on mainstream enthusiasm for crypto ETFs
body: Max Stuedlein, head of strategic digital asset solutions at Sygnum Bank challenged the mainstream enthusiasm around crypto exchange-traded funds. Stuedlein opined that ETFs still carry numerous negatives presented by traditional finance tools. Swiss digital asset bank, Sygnum challenged the hype around crypto ETFs. Max Stuedlein, head of strategic digital asset solutions at Sygnum Bank, commented that ETFs carried limitations that are already staples of traditional financial assets. Sygnum Bank challenges ETF mainstream hype Swiss-regulated Sygnum Bank Sygnum argued that exchange-traded funds weakened crypto’s benefits, such as decentralization. In an interview at Consensus in Hong Kong on Wednesday, Max Stuedlein said the regular market hours that crypto ETFs operated on hinder crypto’s potential. He noted that ETFs are subject to reduced liquidity, restricted trading hours, and limited accessibility. The Sygnum Bank official said that these crypto features attracted users to decentralized finance and cryptocurrencies in the first place. The Sygnum Bank head revealed the company anticipates a divide between specialized crypto-native and traditional finance institutions. He expressed concerns that traditional finance players introduced ETF products and frustrated their efforts. Stuedlein added that investment tools like these threatened to eliminate cryptocurrencies’ distinctive features. He explained that Sygnum Bank intends to develop its products and services based on digital assets that generate value. Bitwise CIO Matt Hougan expressed his views on the growing market interest in cryptocurrency ETFs. He said the ETF trend could lead to an influx of capital in the market. Hougan projected the US SEC could approve spot ETFs for over five digital assets in 2025. According to Hougan, all commodity-based exchange-traded products had regulated future markets. The CIO added that crypto ETFs have no regulated future markets beyond Bitcoin and Ethereum. Bitcoin and Ethereum ETFs record significant inflows CoinGlass data revealed that US spot Bitcoin ETFs accumulated $110 billion a year after their launch. The data highlighted that this amounted to 5.89% of Bitcoin’s market cap. The analytics firm also pointed out that Ethereum ETFs accumulated $10.37B, which amounted to 3.15% of Ethereum’s market cap. According to SosoValue data, Bitcoin ETFs recorded $71.07 million in outflows on February 19. The data revealed Fidelity FBTC experienced the highest outflows of approximately $48.39 million. Other US spot ETFs such as ARK 21Shares’ ARKB and VanEck’s HODL also recorded outflows. Abu Dhabi’s Sovereign Fund, Mubadala Investment Company announced it had invested over $436 million in Blackrock IBIT shares. Barclays also revealed that it owned 2.47 million shares of IBIT in a recent SEC filing. Goldman Sachs and JP Morgan were among other institutions that acknowledged Bitcoin ETF investments. JP Morgan analysts projected in January that XRP and Solana ETFs could record inflows between $3 and $6 billion upon approval. According to Matthew Sigel, head of digital assets research at VanEck, the JP Morgan forecasts considered Bitcoin and Ethereum ETF’s market cap and total outflows. Bloomberg analysts Eric Balchunas and James Seyffart predicted that Trump’s administration would favor more approval from the SEC. The analysts added that Bitcoin-Ethereum combination products would likely take the lead followed by Litecoin (LTC) and Hedera Hashgraph. Seyffart opined that Litecoin and HBAR had higher odds of approval than Solana and XRP. He noted it is unclear whether investor demand was present in the market. title: PACT Protocol Launches on Aptos Network
body: New York City, United States, February 20th, 2025, Chainwire Bringing over $1B in on-chain assets to Aptos from day one. PACT Protocol today launched on Aptos Network , bringing fully on-chain lending and securitization infrastructure for licensed lenders in emerging markets to the high-performance blockchain. This launch brings over $1 billion in on-chain assets onto Aptos and follows nine months of incubation and collaboration with the Aptos Foundation. PACT enables lenders to originate, securitize, and service loans with greater efficiency, as well as ensure borrowers, originators, and institutional investors can operate in a transparent, efficient, and scalable financial environment. PACT is the first participant in Aptos Foundation’s incubation pilot, a program aimed at supporting and scaling high-impact blockchain projects. Aptos Labs provided strategic and technical consultation for the partnership. On-chain credit infrastructure is transforming global finance, particularly in emerging markets where traditional banking services remain out of reach for 85% of the world’s population . By launching on Aptos, PACT is expanding access to credit in underserved markets, making borrowing more affordable and inclusive globally. “This partnership is expanding financial access to those who need it most– users who live in emerging markets across the globe,” said Ash Pampati, Head of Ecosystem, Aptos. “I’m thrilled to see the impact it will have on the Aptos ecosystem and beyond.” “This is what real-world blockchain adoption looks like,” said Solomon Tesfaye, Head of Capital Markets at Aptos Labs, who provided strategic consultation for the partnership. “PACT’s integration with Aptos provides a transparent and scalable solution that reduces costs and expands credit opportunities for underserved communities worldwide.” PACT chose Aptos for the network’s institutional-grade infrastructure, scalability, and adoption in the financial sector. With support for native USDC and USDT, high-profile integrations, and the ability to process high transaction volumes with low fees, Aptos ensures seamless credit flows while maintaining security and reliability through its Move programming language. PACT Protocol utilizes BitGo for custody and compliance, the preferred security and operational backbone for more than 1,500 institutional clients in 50 countries. “PACT’s transition to Aptos unlocks greater efficiency, broader institutional adoption, and real-world financial impact,” said Joshua March, President of Pact Labs, the technology and infrastructure provider behind the PACT Protocol. “With Aptos, we’re driving new levels of scalability, security, and speed, fundamentally transforming how credit markets operate on-chain.” The PACT Protocol enables fintech lenders, institutional investors, and capital market participants to issue, manage, and securitize loans directly on-chain, reducing costs and expanding access to global credit markets. PACT has rapidly grown into one of the largest on-chain lending ecosystems, facilitating billions in loan originations while integrating with major financial institutions, stablecoin issuers, and DeFi platforms. All existing PACT holders will have the opportunity to migrate their tokens to Aptos via an official 1:1 token bridge. The bridge will be available soon, with clear instructions provided. The total supply of PACT remains unchanged. While the Celo PACT token will continue to support ongoing initiatives, future governance, and ecosystem development will take place on Aptos as PACT transitions to its upgraded token. Community members are encouraged to participate in the migration to take full advantage of Aptos’ enhanced infrastructure, broader institutional adoption, and continued ecosystem growth. For more information on PACT’s migration and how to participate, users can visit https://pact.foundation/ About Aptos Network Aptos is a next-generation Layer 1 blockchain. Aptos’ breakthrough technology, scalable infrastructure, and user safeguards are designed to power the next generation of financial systems by offering unparalleled high throughput and low latency that can scale to billions of users. About Aptos Foundation Aptos Foundation is dedicated to supporting the development of the Aptos protocol decentralized network and driving engagement with the Aptos ecosystem. By unlocking a blockchain with seamless usability, the Aptos Foundation aims to bring the benefits of decentralization to the masses. About PACT Protocol PACT Protocol is a permissioned smart contract platform that powers loan origination, payments, warehousing, and securitization fully on-chain. Designed to connect borrowers with global capital, the protocol provides a standardized and transparent lending framework while leveraging blockchain technology to streamline financial processes. Initial development was led by Pact Labs, which continues to support the ecosystem with tools like dashboards, APIs, and SDKs to simplify integration for originators. Contact Communications Lead Hannah Noyes Aptos Labs hannah@aptoslabs.com

title: Bitcoin Bulls Rejoice: Fed Minutes Confirm QT Is Ending
body: On Tuesday, February 19, the Federal Reserve released their meeting minutes, revealing that central bankers are considering an end—or at least a significant slowdown—to quantitative tightening (QT). The document states: “Several participants suggest halting or slowing balance sheet reduction pending debt ceiling resolution.” These remarks have fueled optimism among Bitcoin experts who view the potential end of QT as a bullish signal. Many see it as a precursor to greater liquidity entering financial markets, a condition that has historically benefited risk assets like cryptocurrencies. The newly published minutes confirm that certain Fed officials are worried about the interaction between ongoing balance sheet reduction and the looming debt ceiling debate. The possibility of large-scale US Treasury issuance once the debt ceiling is resolved appears to be a key driver behind calls to pause or halt QT. Related Reading: Bears In Trouble? Bitcoin Liquidity Signals A Brutal Squeeze To $111,000 No explicit shift to quantitative easing (QE) was announced, but the acknowledgment that balance sheet reduction might be curtailed has been enough to stoke speculation in digital asset circles. The minutes must be unanimously approved by the Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC), further suggesting an intentional message from policymakers. Implications For Bitcoin Renowned market commentator and host of the On the Margin podcast, Felix Jauvin, took to X to emphasize the significance of the Fed’s signaling, writing: “There it is, QT coming to an end this spring. Reminder that every FOMC member has to unanimously approve these minutes, this is intentional.” While Jauvin underscores the unanimity behind these minutes, he stops short of predicting an immediate shift toward QE. Instead, he points to a specific chain of events that the Fed seems to be navigating. The Fed has already reduced the pace of balance sheet runoff by half compared to its initial rate. Jauvin also notes that as the reverse repo facility (RRP) nears zero and the Fed reaches its target reserve level of roughly 3% of GDP, an end to QT becomes more likely. Related Reading: Bitcoin Meets Fiscal Reality: Fidelity’s Timmer Predicts What’s Next Moreover, concerns loom over the Treasury General Account (TGA) potentially being rebuilt once the debt ceiling is resolved, leading to sizable bill issuance which could lead to interim disruptions in funding markets. Therefore, rather than pivot to QE, Jauvin believes the Fed could pursue a temporary Supplementary Leverage Ratio (SLR) exemption, allowing commercial banks to absorb additional government debt. “They are very very very very far from any sort of formal QE. Instead, it’s more likely they pursue an SLR exemption allowing commercial banks to be the marginal buyer of debt,” Jauvin predicts. A formal return to QE, Jauvin concludes, would only materialize if financial and economic conditions deteriorate significantly, including a major collapse in risk assets and a drop in rates to near zero. In response to an X user asking if ending QT is bullish without necessarily indicating an immediate move to QE, Jauvin offered a succinct explanation: “Therefore think for the current liquidity backdrop it is marginally improving in that we will have the possible sequence of TGA drawdown into QT ending into potentially SLR exemption, and that’ll be it for now. QE shouldn’t even be in the current vocabulary of discourse as it stands.” Renowned crypto analyst Pentoshi agrees, highlighting a previously published forecast: “QT coming to an end… My guess, QT ends by start of Q3. With all that’s taking place currently Trump will likely end up forcing it. Was correct on QT guess in Nov 21. Let’s see.” He cited how the conclusion of quantitative easing in late 2021 coincided with the end of the crypto bull run. Now, market watchers are keenly observing whether the inverse—a potential termination of QT—could spark renewed momentum for Bitcoin and other digital assets. At press time, BTC traded at $97,208. Featured image created with DALL.E, chart from TradingView.com
tags: Bitcoin|bitcoin|Bitcoin news|bitcoin price|btc|BTC news|btc price|Fed Minutes|FOMC|QT|US Federal Reserve

title: PACT Protocol Launches on Aptos Network
body: New York City, United States, February 20th, 2025, Chainwire Bringing over $1B in on-chain assets to Aptos from day one. PACT Protocol today launched on Aptos Network , bringing fully on-chain lending and securitization infrastructure for licensed lenders in emerging markets to the high-performance blockchain. This launch brings over $1 billion in on-chain assets onto Aptos and follows nine months of incubation and collaboration with the Aptos Foundation. PACT enables lenders to originate, securitize, and service loans with greater efficiency, as well as ensure borrowers, originators, and institutional investors can operate in a transparent, efficient, and scalable financial environment. PACT is the first participant in Aptos Foundation’s incubation pilot, a program aimed at supporting and scaling high-impact blockchain projects. Aptos Labs provided strategic and technical consultation for the partnership. On-chain credit infrastructure is transforming global finance, particularly in emerging markets where traditional banking services remain out of reach for 85% of the world's population . By launching on Aptos, PACT is expanding access to credit in underserved markets, making borrowing more affordable and inclusive globally. “This partnership is expanding financial access to those who need it most– users who live in emerging markets across the globe,” said Ash Pampati, Head of Ecosystem, Aptos. “I’m thrilled to see the impact it will have on the Aptos ecosystem and beyond.” "This is what real-world blockchain adoption looks like,” said Solomon Tesfaye, Head of Capital Markets at Aptos Labs, who provided strategic consultation for the partnership. “PACT’s integration with Aptos provides a transparent and scalable solution that reduces costs and expands credit opportunities for underserved communities worldwide." PACT chose Aptos for the network’s institutional-grade infrastructure, scalability, and adoption in the financial sector. With support for native USDC and USDT, high-profile integrations, and the ability to process high transaction volumes with low fees, Aptos ensures seamless credit flows while maintaining security and reliability through its Move programming language. PACT Protocol utilizes BitGo for custody and compliance, the preferred security and operational backbone for more than 1,500 institutional clients in 50 countries. “PACT’s transition to Aptos unlocks greater efficiency, broader institutional adoption, and real-world financial impact,” said Joshua March, President of Pact Labs, the technology and infrastructure provider behind the PACT Protocol. “With Aptos, we’re driving new levels of scalability, security, and speed, fundamentally transforming how credit markets operate on-chain.” The PACT Protocol enables fintech lenders, institutional investors, and capital market participants to issue, manage, and securitize loans directly on-chain, reducing costs and expanding access to global credit markets. PACT has rapidly grown into one of the largest on-chain lending ecosystems, facilitating billions in loan originations while integrating with major financial institutions, stablecoin issuers, and DeFi platforms. All existing PACT holders will have the opportunity to migrate their tokens to Aptos via an official 1:1 token bridge. The bridge will be available soon, with clear instructions provided. The total supply of PACT remains unchanged. While the Celo PACT token will continue to support ongoing initiatives, future governance, and ecosystem development will take place on Aptos as PACT transitions to its upgraded token. Community members are encouraged to participate in the migration to take full advantage of Aptos’ enhanced infrastructure, broader institutional adoption, and continued ecosystem growth. For more information on PACT’s migration and how to participate, users can visit https://pact.foundation/ About Aptos Network Aptos is a next-generation Layer 1 blockchain. Aptos’ breakthrough technology, scalable infrastructure, and user safeguards are designed to power the next generation of financial systems by offering unparalleled high throughput and low latency that can scale to billions of users. About Aptos Foundation Aptos Foundation is dedicated to supporting the development of the Aptos protocol decentralized network and driving engagement with the Aptos ecosystem. By unlocking a blockchain with seamless usability, the Aptos Foundation aims to bring the benefits of decentralization to the masses. About PACT Protocol PACT Protocol is a permissioned smart contract platform that powers loan origination, payments, warehousing, and securitization fully on-chain. Designed to connect borrowers with global capital, the protocol provides a standardized and transparent lending framework while leveraging blockchain technology to streamline financial processes. Initial development was led by Pact Labs, which continues to support the ecosystem with tools like dashboards, APIs, and SDKs to simplify integration for originators. ContactCommunications LeadHannah NoyesAptos Labshannah@aptoslabs.com Disclaimer: This is a sponsored press release and is for informational purposes only. It does not reflect the views of Crypto Daily, nor is it intended to be used as legal, tax, investment, or financial advice.
