title: Argentina’s president Javier Milei arrives in Washington amid crypto scandal
body: Argentina’s president Javier Milei touched down in Washington, D.C., on Thursday, arriving in the middle of the biggest political firestorm of his presidency. Javier’s visit—scheduled weeks in advance—was originally about securing an International Monetary Fund (IMF) deal and strengthening ties with Donald Trump’s administration. But now, Javier is walking into a different battle: explaining his involvement in a memecoin collapse that erased $4.6 billion in market value overnight. Javier’s US itinerary is stacked. He’s set to meet Elon Musk, one of his most vocal supporters and a close friend, before delivering a speech at CPAC—the Trump-friendly Conservative Political Action Conference. His team has been scrambling to turn the conversation away from the $LIBRA debacle and back to his economic agenda. But back in Argentina, the scandal isn’t going away. $LIBRA token collapses after Javier’s promotion The controversy exploded last Friday when Javier personally endorsed $LIBRA, a newly launched cryptocurrency, in a post on X (formerly Twitter). The token immediately surged, attracting speculators who saw the Argentine president’s backing as a signal to buy in. But just hours later, the price crashed, wiping out billions. Javier deleted the post, and his office distanced itself from the project, but it was already too late. Then came Hayden Davis, a key figure behind the token. Hayden told investors that Javier was more involved than he let on, claiming in leaked text messages —published by CoinDesk—that he paid Karina Javier, the president’s sister and closest advisor, to “control” Javier. Davis denied that he had made any payments to the president or his sister, or sent the messages. Milei denied any wrongdoing in a television interview on Monday. But the damage was done. The opposition pounced, accusing Javier of either incompetence or outright corruption. Javier responded on Monday night in an interview on Argentinian television, saying he never received money for the promotion and calling the accusations an attempt to smear his presidency. He didn’t clarify why he initially backed the token or why he deleted the post, leaving more questions than answers. Market reaction and the IMF talks in Washington The fallout hit Argentina’s markets hard. The Buenos Aires stock index dropped 6% on Monday before recovering slightly. The country’s already fragile peso took another hit, adding pressure on Javier’s economic team. Javier’s biggest priority in Washington is securing an IMF deal. His government has been in negotiations for months, trying to unlock new funding and ease Argentina’s currency controls. Economy Minister Luis Caputo said on Monday that the agreement was “almost done”, but sources close to the talks suggest the IMF still has concerns—particularly about Javier’s handling of the peso’s exchange rate. The IMF has pushed for a more flexible currency policy, but Javier’s team insists on controlling the rate to prevent inflation from spiraling further. While Javier has been one of Trump’s strongest allies on the global stage, the US president’s new tariff plan could put Argentina in a difficult position. Trump is pushing for reciprocal levies on countries that impose heavy duties on US goods, and Argentina’s protectionist trade policies could make it a target. Javier is expected to raise concerns about the tariffs when he meets with top US officials this week. His government has been trying to align more closely with Washington, but trade policy could strain the relationship—even as Javier cultivates personal ties with Trump’s inner circle. Despite the scandal back home, Javier is set to receive a warm welcome at CPAC. The conservative crowd embraces his free-market stance and aggressive anti-establishment rhetoric. Last year, Javier’s speech at the same event went viral among right-wing circles, and his team is betting on another strong reception to help drown out the crypto controversy. Before CPAC, Javier is scheduled to meet Elon Musk. Musk has been one of his biggest defenders, calling him a “true reformer” and backing his aggressive economic policies. Their meeting is expected to focus on energy, trade, and digital assets. Crypto will almost certainly come up—but whether Musk addresses the $LIBRA debacle remains to be seen. The crypto community, meanwhile, has been divided over the scandal. One Argentinian X user posted: “ The main thing I can say after $LIBRA incident is that I believe even more in Bitcoin and Ethereum than even before and I’m sure Argentineans will play a crucial role in global crypto adoption. We’re resilient as fuck. ” Ethereum created Vitalik Buterin reacted , saying: “Argentina’s Ethereum community is full of amazing builders, who have already contributed some of the most important software in the Ethereum ecosystem.” He suggested that Argentina should host Devconnect, a major Ethereum developer conference, citing the country’s strong crypto talent. Javier responded publicly: “THANK YOU VERY MUCH, Vitalik Buterin FOR YOUR WORDS ABOUT ARGENTINE TALENT!!! It would be an honor for Argentina to host Devconnect. LONG LIVE FREEDOM, DAMN IT…!!!” Cryptopolitan Academy: FREE Web3 Resume Cheat Sheet - Download Now

title: Is the Current Bitcoin Price Cheap or Expensive? Analytics Company Shares Its Special Metric
body: Cryptocurrency analytics firm Alphractal has examined the current valuation of Bitcoin using the Short-Term Flow Fair Value metric and clarified whether BTC is cheap or expensive in the current market conditions. The Short-Term Flow Fair Value metric measures the relationship between new Bitcoin issuance and its absorption by the market. It takes into account the following: BTC inflows and outflows on exchanges affecting trading liquidity. Miner supply as miners frequently sell BTC to cover operational expenses. Transaction fees play a role in supply and demand dynamics. A high Short-Term Flow Fair Value indicates that more BTC is being absorbed by the market, reducing selling pressure and potentially supporting the price. Conversely, a drop in this metric indicates that more coins are entering the market via exchanges and miner sales, increasing selling pressure. Related News: Another Cryptocurrency-Friendly Decision from the New SEC - Erasing the Traces of the Old One by One Alphractal notes that the metric reached an all-time high in February but has recently started to fall. However, it remains high, indicating that Bitcoin’s absorption levels are still strong despite the recent pullback. In addition to Short-Term Flow Fair Value, Alphractal also notes the Aggregate Funding Rate across exchanges. It is currently approaching negative territory but remains positive overall. Negative funding rates across major exchanges have historically been associated with local bottoms, suggesting a shift in market sentiment may be on the horizon. *This is not investment advice. Continue Reading: Is the Current Bitcoin Price Cheap or Expensive? Analytics Company Shares Its Special Metric

title: ChatGPT Predicts Timeline for Shiba Inu’s (SHIB) Return to Its All-Time High
body: Shiba Inu, the popular memecoin, experienced a massive surge in 2021, delivering an unprecedented return of 46,000,000%. By the end of that year, its price had climbed from an opening value of $0.000000000073 to $0.000034. At its peak, SHIB reached an all-time high of $0.00008616, reflecting an even more remarkable 118,000,000% increase. Since then, the market has undergone a significant downturn. As of report time, the asset trades at $0.00001536, approximately 82% below its record high. Given its sharp decline , many investors are eager to know when the token could reclaim its previous peak. OpenAI’s ChatGPT has provided three potential scenarios based on market trends, historical price cycles, and ongoing developments within the ecosystem. Conservative Projection: 2028–2030 Under a scenario where the token’s recovery is driven by organic adoption rather than speculative hype, ChatGPT estimates that the memecoin may not reach its all-time high again until between 2028 and 2030. This outlook assumes that SHIB’s growth will primarily depend on continued development within its ecosystem, particularly the adoption of Shibarium, its Ethereum Layer 2 scaling solution. A steady increase in real-world usage and utility within the ecosystem would serve as the key drivers for long-term value appreciation. Moderate Projection: 2025–2026 If the cryptocurrency market experiences a strong bullish cycle, the asset could potentially recover more quickly. ChatGPT predicts that in a scenario where Bitcoin surges to a price range of $150,000 to $200,000, SHIB could return to its all-time high between 2025 and 2026. In this case, the token’s growth would likely be influenced by broader market momentum, with altcoins following Bitcoin’s lead . Additional contributing factors would include increased token burns, which reduce supply, and greater adoption of Shibarium, further strengthening the ecosystem. We are on twitter, follow us to connect with us :- @TimesTabloid1 — TimesTabloid (@TimesTabloid1) July 15, 2023 Optimistic Projection: Early 2025 ChatGPT’s most aggressive estimate suggests that the asset could reach its all-time high as early as the beginning of 2025. This scenario would require a combination of factors, including a strong bull market, heightened speculative interest, large-scale token burns, and substantial buy volume. However, given current market conditions as of February 20, 2025, this outlook appears increasingly unlikely as the token approaches a death cross. While SHIB has yet to reclaim its 2021 peak, its future trajectory will depend on market cycles, adoption trends, and ecosystem developments. If a strong bull market materializes and key catalysts such as Shibarium adoption and token burns accelerate, SHIB may reach its all-time high sooner rather than later. However, if growth continues at a slow pace, a longer recovery period should be expected. Ultimately, predicting the exact timeline remains speculative, but market participants will be closely monitoring the token’s progress to determine whether it can achieve another historic rally. title: S&P Global says regulatory gap hampers U.S. stablecoins adoption
body: S&P Global, an American financial research and analytics firm, revealed that gaps in regulation remained a stumbling block for the adoption of stablecoins. S&P noted that a regulatory framework could increase stablecoin adoption in the U.S. and help close the gap with Europe, where the markets in crypto-assets regulation came into force in mid-2024. The S&P report highlighted the details of three proposals that were currently under consideration as the debate on stablecoin regulation in the U.S. raged on. According to the report, each of the three proposals sets strict requirements for stablecoin issuers, including maintaining sufficient stablecoin reserves backed by cash and treasuries with maturity that is less than three months. The stablecoin reserves should also be backed by insured deposits and repurchase agreements (repos) with less than seven days’ maturity that are also backed by reverse repos, treasury bills with less than three months’ maturity, and central bank reserves. Stablecoin issuers were also required to ‘segregate between the underlying assets of the stablecoin and their assets’, disclose the redemption policy, and publish monthly compositions of the reserves, which are to be examined by a registered public accounting firm. Other requirements include maintaining a certain capital level that will ensure sufficient liquidity and meeting certain standards when managing risks related to interest rates, operations, compliance, and information technology. Report suggests regulation proposals differ on the State and Federal level S&P reports steady growth of $USDT and $USDC in the crypto market but asserts U.S. stablecoin adoption is slowed by lack of regulation. A clear guidance is urgently needed for full potential unleashing. — Alfa AI (@AlfaTerminal) February 20, 2025 The S&P Global report mentioned that the three proposals differed on whether and when an issuer was regulated at the federal level or the state level. As per the report, one proposal stipulated that the office of the comptroller of the currency should supervise stablecoins with underlying assets of at least $10 billion if the issuer was not a bank. However, smaller stablecoin issuers could opt for state regulations if they were closely similar to the proposed federal regulation. The report clarified that this would be subject to approval by the treasury secretary. S&P also disclosed that the other proposals required the treasury secretary and other regulators to conduct a study on endogenously collateralized stablecoins (ECS) and demand a ‘two-year moratorium’ for the issuance of ECS. The S&P team believes that stablecoins will play an increasingly important role in on-chain transactions to protect savings from local monetary instability in emerging markets or to receive remittances. The report claimed that USD-pegged coins continued to dominate the stablecoin industry, although tokenized money market funds with stablecoin subscription and redemption mechanisms had recently emerged. The market capitalization of stablecoins increased to $230 billion as of February 15th, up from about $160 billion six months ago. S&P expects increased stablecoins adoption among institutions According to the S&P report, the lack of regulation and supervision in the U.S. has prevented a broader institutional adoption of stablecoins, especially for financial transactions and digital bond issuances. S&P forecasts that some users are likely to transition progressively from unregulated to regulated stablecoins, thus changing the current industry landscape. The study on ECS could also tighten regulations on the use of ECS once it is complete. The report stated that the role of stablecoins will continue to evolve and could eventually lead to more integration between traditional finance and decentralized finance. The lack of an agreement about the tools that should be used to bring money natively on-chain was among the main factors that hindered the development of digital bonds and RWA tokenization. S&P pointed out that jurisdictions like the EU, Hong Kong, and Singapore were leading with comprehensive approaches for their regions while the U.S. continued to deliberate on federal legislation. Important matters such as reserve transparency, issuer solvency, and the ability to redeem stablecoins for their pegged value were critical to safeguarding consumers. title: SEC Announces Creation of New Cyber and Emerging Technologies Unit (CETU) To Complement Crypto Task Force
body: Laura D’Allaird has been appointed chief of the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission’s new crypto watchdog, said the SEC in a new announcement. The SEC says the new Cyber and Emerging Technologies Unit (CETU) will replace the old Crypto Assets and Cyber Unit. CETU says it will “combat misconduct” relating to securities in the areas of emerging technologies fraud, social media and dark web fraud, hacking, brokerage account takeovers, crypto fraud, cybersecurity compliance, and cybersecurity fraud. D’Allaird is an attorney who has served as Senior Counsel in the SEC’s Cyber Unit Enforcement Division. Said Acting Chairman Mark T. Uyeda of the new unit, “Importantly, the new unit will also allow the SEC to deploy enforcement resources judiciously. The unit will not only protect investors but will also facilitate capital formation and market efficiency by clearing the way for innovation to grow. It will root out those seeking to misuse innovation to harm investors and diminish confidence in new technologies.” One of CETU’s aims will be to combat crypto fraud by complementing the work of the SEC’s Crypto Task Force, led by Commissioner Hester Pierce. Earlier this week, Pierce sent out a warning to memecoin traders – if things go wrong, the SEC might not bail them out. “Just because something is out there and it’s popular does not mean that it will fit within the SEC jurisdiction. So I just caution people not to assume that there’s going to be an SEC regulatory backstop to everything…” Don't Miss a Beat – Subscribe to get email alerts delivered directly to your inbox Check Price Action Follow us on X , Facebook and Telegram Surf The Daily Hodl Mix Disclaimer: Opinions expressed at The Daily Hodl are not investment advice. title: Two Men Plead Guilty to ‘Massive’ $577,000,000 Crypto Mining Fraud Scheme: DOJ
body: The U.S. Department of Justice (DOJ) says that two Estonian nationals pleaded guilty to operating a massive cryptocurrency Ponzi scheme that defrauded hundreds of thousands of victims from across the globe, including the United States. In a statement, the DOJ says that Sergei Potapenko and Ivan Turõgin sold contracts that entitled their customers to a share of the cryptocurrency mined by their purported crypto mining service, HashFlare. Court documents show that from 2015 to 2019, HashFlare made over $577 million in sales despite not having the computing capacity needed for most of the mining that the defendants claimed it performed. HashFlare’s web-based platform, which was supposed to show customers their mining profits, also reflected falsified data. The DOJ says Potapenko and Turõgin used the proceeds of the scheme to buy luxury cars and real estate, as well as maintain investment and cryptocurrency accounts. On February 12th, both men pleaded guilty to one count of conspiracy to commit wire fraud, which is punishable by up to 20 years in prison. As part of their guilty plea, the duo agreed to forfeit assets valued at over $400 million, which will be available for a remission process to compensate victims of their fraud scheme. A federal district court judge will issue the sentence on May 8th. title: Bybit CEO Labels Pi Network a Scam, Refuses To List Token
body: Amid increasing enthusiasm surrounding the Pi Network, Bybit CEO Ben Zhou labeled it a scam. Clarifying that Bybit has no plans to list the PI token, the Bybit CEO questioned the project’s legitimacy. Meanwhile, the PI token’s value plummeted by over 55% in a single day, causing alarm among investors. Despite its initial popularity, the token’s downward spiral has raised concerns about its long-term viability. Pi Network Is a Scam, Says Bybit CEO Bybit CEO Ben Zhou has publicly voiced his skepticism about the Pi Network’s legitimacy, calling it a scam. In a recent X post , Zhou explicitly stated that Bybit will not list the PI token, reaffirming his doubts about its authenticity. He stated, “I still think you are a scam, and no , Bybit will not list scam.” Referring to a 2021 warning from the People’s Government of Hengyang, Zhou pointed out that the Chinese Police deemed Pi Network as a scam targeting elderly folks. According to reports, the government has issued a warning against Pi Network’s alleged plans to misuse the public’s personal data to accumulate pension funds. The Bybit CEO added, “There are multiple other reports out there questioning the project legitimacy.” Bybit Has No Plans to List PI Token Reiterating his previous stance, Ben Zhou stated that Bybit is not listing the Pi token, due to scam concerns. In a previous post, he dismissed rumors of Bybit listing the Pi token, with a message in Chinese. The post is translated as, A bunch of people asked me today if I wanted to list Pi. I said, ‘Stop being ridiculous.’ Back when I was trading forex, I was constantly confronted by middle-aged people demanding their hard-earned money back. I really don’t want to deal with that in the crypto space—so I’m keeping my distance. Thanks In the recent thread, Zhou confirmed that Bybit hasn’t submitted a listing request for the PI token. He reiterated that allegations of PI turning down Bybit’s listing or failing the exchange’s KYB verification process are unfounded. Further questioning the project’s legitimacy, Zhou stated, “If the project is legitimate and straight up, then you should come forth and address these report so everyone can understand , but instead you choose to make up shit and do these childish attack with no ground.” Notably, Binance is currently conducting a community poll to gauge interest in listing Pi. So far, the majority of voters are in favor of adding the coin to the platform. PI Plummets: What’s Next? Despite the initial hype, Pi Network’s PI token has plummeted by a massive 59.58% over the last 24 hours. However, traders remain optimistic about the token which is evident from the staggering 2833% surge in its trading volume. At press time, the PI token is trading in the red zone, at a price of $0.7806, significantly down from the high of $1.99. However, driven by the initial parabolic uptrend, analysts remain bullish. As per Pi price prediction , the token is poised to hit $300 driven by potential listings by major exchanges. title: Dogecoin Open Interest Plunges 58%: How Do Shiba Inu & Pepe Compare?
body: Data shows the Dogecoin Open Interest has seen a large drop recently. Here’s how the trend has compared for Shiba Inu and other memecoins. Dogecoin Has Witnessed A Decline In Open Interest Recently In a new post on X, the analytics firm Glassnode has discussed about the latest trend in the Open Interest for the various memecoins in the cryptocurrency sector. The “Open Interest” here refers to an indicator that keeps track of the total amount of positions related to a given asset currently open on all derivatives exchanges. Related Reading: Bitcoin RHODL Momentum Slowing Down—Analyst Warns Pattern ‘Not Ideal’ First, here is a chart that shows the trend in the 7-day moving average (MA) of the metric for Dogecoin, the original meme-based token: As is visible in the above graph, the 7-day MA of the Dogecoin Open Interest had a value of $3.5 billion in December, but since then, speculative interest around the asset has plummeted as it has come down to just $1.49 billion today. This represents a decrease of around 58.4%. DOGE isn’t the only memecoin that has gone through a futures flush in this period, however, as the second chart shared by the analytics firm shows. From the graph, it’s apparent that Pepe (PEPE), Bonk (BONK), and dogwifhat (WIF) have all seen a cooldown in Open Interest during the last couple of months. The decline has even been more pronounced than DOGE’s for all of these, as the metric has fallen by more than 69% for them. Shiba Inu (SHIB) and Floki (FLOKI) have likewise followed suit, with the indicator declining by 74% and 69%, respectively. While speculative activity on the futures market has taken the deep dive across the memecoins, it appears the trend has been different for other parts of the cryptocurrency sector. Related Reading: Ethereum Fees Back To Lowest Since August: Is This Bullish? Here is a chart that the analytics firm has shared in another X post, which shows how the percentage change in the Open Interest has compared between meme-based assets and three of the top coins (Bitcoin (BTC), Ethereum (ETH), and Solana (SOL)): As displayed in the above graph, Bitcoin, Ethereum, and Solana have registered a drop of 11%, 23%, and 6% on the metric, respectively. Clearly, this is significantly less than the 52% crash that the memecoin market combined has observed. DOGE Price Dogecoin has been locked in sideways movement during the last couple of weeks as its price is still trading around $0.25. Featured image from Dall-E, Glassnode.com, chart from TradingView.com

title: Ethereum Consolidation Continues – Here Are Key Levels To Watch For A Potential Surge
body: Ethereum (ETH) continues to trade in a tight consolidation range, keeping traders and investors on high alert for a potential breakout. The price has struggled to establish a clear trend, with bulls attempting to push higher while bears hold firm at key resistance levels. This prolonged phase of sideways movement suggests that ETH is gearing up for its next big move—but the direction remains uncertain. Periods of consolidation often act as a springboard for significant price swings, making it crucial to watch the key support and resistance zones closely. A breakout above resistance could ignite bullish momentum, while a drop below support might trigger a fresh wave of selling pressure. With market sentiment shifting and external factors influencing price action, Ethereum’s next move could be just around the corner. Current Price Action And Technical Indicators Ethereum’s price action remains in a consolidation phase, with neither bulls nor bears establishing a clear trend. The market is showing signs of reduced volatility, indicating a breakout may be on the horizon. ETH is trading within a defined range, testing key support and resistance levels that will determine its next move. Related Reading: Ethereum Fees Back To Lowest Since August: Is This Bullish? Technical indicators provide mixed signals. The Relative Strength Index (RSI) hovers near a neutral zone, suggesting neither overbought nor oversold conditions. Meanwhile, moving averages highlight key levels as ETH struggles to gain momentum above crucial resistance zones. Volume remains relatively low, signaling a lack of strong buying or selling pressure. With these indicators in focus, Ethereum’s next major move will likely depend on whether bulls can break resistance or if bears succeed in driving prices lower. Traders should keep a close watch on crucial levels to anticipate the direction of the next big price swing. Potential Scenarios For Ethereum: Bullish Surge vs. Bearish Breakdown As Ethereum continues its extended consolidation, the market braces for two possible outcomes: a bullish surge or a bearish breakdown. Both scenarios carry significant implications for traders and investors, making this a critical juncture for ETH’s price action. Related Reading: Altseason At Risk? Expert Believes Ethereum Must Hold $2,600 To Sustain Momentum If buyers regain control and push ETH above the key $2,862 resistance level, a strong breakout is likely to occur. A surge in buying pressure alongside increasing volume, may trigger a rally toward the next major resistance zone at $3,051. More investors are expected to be drawn following a successful move past this level, reinforcing upward momentum. On the other hand, if selling pressure intensifies and Ethereum loses critical $2,518 support, a bearish breakdown could occur. This would open the door for a deeper retracement, testing lower demand zones. A decline in volume on recovery attempts would indicate weak bullish interest, increasing the likelihood of further downside. In this case, Ethereum eyes lower support zones such as $2,160 before finding stability. Featured image from Unsplash, chart from Tradingview.com

title: Canada’s OSFI sets new guidelines for banks to manage crypto exposure
body: Canada’s banking regulator, the Office of Superintendent of Financial Institutions (OSFI) has introduced rules for banks to manage their exposure in cryptocurrency as interest in digital assets continues to grow in the country. The OSFI announced the final guidelines in the regulator’s quarterly report on Thursday, on cryptocurrency assets, together with consultation on capital requirements amid a major shift in the regulatory approach in the US where requirements are expected to ease. The initiative marks a significant step in digital assets and financial stability. According to the Globe and Mail , the OSFI has been reviewing how Canada’s banks manage risks associated with crypto-assets. These include platforms and currencies such as Bitcoin – in their client portfolios. According to the regulation, banks should consider crypto that sits directly on their balance sheets, as well as asset exposures among their customers, at a time adoption of digital assets is improving. The Globe and Mail has reported that Canadians who own Bitcoin jumped to 13% in 2021 from 5% in 2018, largely among men, as per figures released by the Bank of Canada in December. While the OSFI is of the view that the current risk is relatively low, activity is picking up quickly, which calls for more oversight, according to Assistant Superintendent and Chief Strategy and Risk Officer Angie Radiskovic. “We’re in a market where crypto is starting to pick up dramatically,” Ms. Radiskovic said during a conference call with reporters. title: SEC unveils cyber and emerging technologies unit to tackle crypto and AI fraud
body: Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) has announced the creation of the Cyber and Emerging Technologies Unit (CETU), a specialized task force aimed at cracking down on cyber-related misconduct and safeguarding retail investors from evolving digital threats. According to Acting Chairman Mark Uyeda, the unit will safeguard investors and support capital formation and market efficiency by paving the way for innovation to thrive. He also noted that it would eliminate those attempting to misuse innovation to harm investors and erode confidence in new technologies. Laura D’Allaird takes charge of the new SEC unit The new division will be headed by Laura D’Allaird and replace the former Crypto Assets and Cyber Unit. D’Allaird has been at the SEC for several years in various enforcement roles. The CETU comprises approximately 30 fraud specialists and attorneys across SEC offices. The Cyber and Emerging Technologies Unit’s mission includes identifying and eliminating cyber threats that exploit emerging technologies such as artificial intelligence and blockchain. According to Uyeda, the unit will play a critical role in enforcing regulations while fostering market confidence. CETU’s focus encompasses hacking attempts against nonpublic financial information, unauthorized takeovers of retail brokerage accounts, fraud in blockchain technology and crypto assets, cybersecurity compliance deficiencies among regulated entities, and misleading disclosures concerning cybersecurity risks by public companies. Uyeda noted that the new unit would also parallel Commissioner Hester Peirce ‘s work within the newly formed Crypto Task Force. As recently as last month, Peirce laid out her priorities for that task force, including classifying certain tokens as “non-securities.” Following the new Trump administration’s taking office, the SEC has embarked upon a regulatory change distinct from that of former Chair Gary Gensler. The agency had previously expressed skepticism about crypto and argued that many cryptocurrencies are actually securities. In forming Peirce’s task force, the agency said its goal was to put the SEC on a “sensible regulatory path that respects the limits of the law.” LIBRA collapse ignites debate over insider trading and regulatory failures While insider trading allegations regarding crypto have been discussed for years, the debate has intensified since Feb. 14, when the LIBRA meme coin crashed. The meme coin, championed by Javier Milei, the president of Argentina, became synonymous with a space stacked against retail investors who suffer from not having the advantages of inside information. The rug pull, which made more than $100 million for the team behind the token, resulted in losses of more than $251 million to investors after the token was artificially inflated and then dumped. The rug pull took place on Jupiter, a decentralized exchange on Solana, which claimed that the launch of a Milei-backed meme coin was widely known among meme coin circles. In the meantime, Jupiter has started an investigation, and one Meteora co-founder has stepped back amid the fallout. SEC strengthens cybersecurity oversight in the digital age Emerging financial technologies have created a complex regulatory ecosystem. With increasing digital fraud, federal and state government agencies are ramping up efforts to strengthen identity verification and fraud prevention systems. Modern solutions integrating third-party consumer data and device intelligence are becoming essential to combat synthetic identities and safeguard public services. The SEC’s new unit wants to stay ahead of the trend, drawing on the team’s deep knowledge of fintech and cybersecurity. Cryptopolitan Academy: FREE Web3 Resume Cheat Sheet - Download Now

title: 5 Best Crypto Trading Platforms in 2025
body: The cryptocurrency market can be quite complicated. There are so many different coins, trading methods, and prices that change frequently. This can be overwhelming, especially for those who are new to it. Crypto trading platforms were created to soften these barriers, making it easier for users to invest, trade, and, simply put – navigate the market. These platforms provide easy-to-understand strategies and, in some cases, offer automated trading using bots that follow potentially successful strategies. However, since there are so many trading platforms available, it can be challenging to decide which one to choose. This article will look at some of 2025’s best crypto trading platforms for people with different levels of experience and investment goals. We will discuss the strengths and weaknesses of each platform and highlight their unique features, and explain which one is currently the best choice for both beginners and those who've been trading for a while. Choosing the Right Crypto Trading Platform Whether you're a long-term investor looking for structured diversification or a high-stakes trader chasing volatility, understanding the key differences between platforms is crucial. This review examines some of the top crypto trading platforms, highlighting how they cater to different types of users. The key factors that impact their attractiveness include: Entry barriers – How accessible the platform is for different types of users, from complete beginners to seasoned traders. Centralization vs. decentralization – Whether the platform is governed by a central entity or operates through decentralized governance, giving users a say in key decisions. Passive income opportunities – Whether users can earn through staking, fee-sharing, or holding assets, or if profitability is solely dependent on active trading. Risk exposure & mitigation – Whether the platform offers tools to minimize risk, such as diversified investments, or encourages high-risk strategies like leverage trading. Customization & trading flexibility – The ability to create personalized investment strategies, such as custom indexes or algorithmic trading setups. Innovation & Web3 integration – Whether the platform is building next-gen DeFi solutions like decentralized index trading or simply offering traditional finance tools repackaged for crypto. Platform Entry Barriers Centralization Passive Income Risk Exposure Customization Innovation CryptoIndex Low Decentralized Yes Low High High Iconomi Medium Centralized Yes Medium Medium Medium Mudrex Low Centralized No Medium Low Medium BitMEX High Centralized No High High Low Delta Exchange High Centralized No High High Low 1. CryptoIndex: The All-in-One Web3 Index Trading Platform Indexes are the most popular financial instruments globally, generating over $224 trillion annually in traditional finance (TradFi). CryptoIndex is the first Web3 protocol to introduce index trading to crypto, unlocking a projected $500 billion market in the industry. This platform brands itself as the "Nasdaq of crypto" and does it for a reason. For those who don't know, crypto indexes are collections of different cryptocurrencies hand-picked and put together by experts, based on their market potential, growth prospects, and alignment with current trends. These indexes can then be invested into and traded like traditional financial instruments, allowing investors to gain exposure to a well-constructed portfolio without having to buy each cryptocurrency individually. By investing in a crypto index, individuals can reduce their risk through diversification, as the performance isn't solely reliant on a single asset. This makes them an appealing option for both new and experienced investors looking to get into the volatile market with more confidence. CryptoIndex enables both index creation and index purchasing. While investing in pre-made indexes offers a more efficient way to generate profits, experienced traders can monetize their market insights by providing paid access to their custom indexes. Each index creator sets entry and exit fees, with a portion going to the creator and the rest distributed to index token holders. As a holder, you earn a share of these fees every time someone joins or leaves the index, meaning the longer you hold, the more passive income you generate. All the fees on the CryptoIndex platform are paid in $INDX tokens, and with each transaction, demand increases, strengthening the tokenomics. Benefits of holding the $INDX tokens include up to 35% fee discounts, special perks, and rewards for those who stake them, all of which can help increase profits when trading on the platform. Unlike TradFi, where users only have access to periodic reports with limited information, the CryptoIndex platform allows tracking all transactions 24/7. Moreover, few platforms offer real opportunities for crypto index trading, and those that do come with major limitations – restricted index availability, small token selections, and access to only a few dozen assets. CryptoIndex changes that with over 30,000 coins on DEX, extensive customization, and more than 1,000 expert-created indexes. This democratizes crypto investing, letting creators monetize their communities while users find indexes that match their risk and strategy. Pros and Cons of CryptoIndex As great as it may seem, it’s important to look at the advantages and disadvantages of CryptoIndex. Pros: Wide range of indexes: CryptoIndex offers over 1,000 indexes that cover many areas of the cryptocurrency market. Whether you’re interested in meme coins, DeFi projects, protocols, Layer 2 blockchains – you’re likely to find something that suits your interests. Some of the most popular indexes offered by the platform include GLOB, DELE, and L2S, allowing users to invest smartly in global blockchain, decentralized ledger, and Layer 2 coins. Easy to use: The platform is designed to be user-friendly. It’s simple to connect your crypto wallet and start trading indexes in just one click. "Hold to Earn" feature: This feature allows you to earn money just by holding $INDX tokens. You receive a share of the trading fees generated within the index, which gives you an additional reason to keep your tokens beyond hoping their price will go up. Community control: Each index is managed by a Decentralized Autonomous Organization ( DAO ). This means that token holders can vote on important matters, such as rebalancing the index or changing fees. This structure promotes transparency and gives the community a voice in how things are run. Create your own index: CryptoIndex allows users to create their own custom indexes by choosing from over 30,000 tokens across different blockchains. This feature lets you implement your own investment ideas and strategies and earn a share of the fees every time someone trades or invests in your index. Qualified team and high-profile partnerships: CryptoIndex benefits from a world-class team of experts from Binance, Visa, and Deutsche Börse, along with strategic partnerships with Nasdaq and BNB Chain, bringing the expertise and connections needed to drive success. Cons: New platform: CryptoIndex is relatively new, having launched in December 2024. While this brings exciting opportunities, it also means that the platform is still developing, and some features may change or improve over time. Intricacies of index trading: Even though the platform is easy to use, the concept of index trading can be slightly complicated for complete beginners. It’s essential to understand how markets work and how to manage risks properly. CryptoIndex stands out because it offers a complete approach to crypto index trading. The easy-to-use platform, a wide selection of indexes, and the opportunity to earn passive income just by holding index tokens make it attractive to all levels of traders. The community-led governance adds to its appeal, making it transparent and community-focused. 2. Iconomi: A Social Trading Platform Iconomi is a social trading platform that allows users to follow and copy the trading strategies of experienced traders. This means you can learn from others who have more knowledge and experience in cryptocurrency trading. On Iconomi, you can browse profiles of various experienced traders, check their past performance, and see the strategies they use. If you find a trader whose approach you like, you can choose to automatically copy their trades. When you do this, any trades they make will automatically be mirrored in your own account. So, if they make a successful trade, you can benefit from their expertise without having to do all the research yourself, but if they lose money, you lose too. In addition to the potential to earn money, Iconomi offers a valuable learning experience. Watching how skilled traders operate, can help you gain insights into different trading techniques and how to analyze the market. Pros and Cons of Iconomi Copying trades from experts might seem like a good idea but it comes with its own advantages and disadvantages. Let’s look at the pros and cons of using Iconomi: Pros: Learn from experts: Apart from just copy-trading, Iconomi lets you learn from experienced traders. You can see their strategies and understand how they approach trading, which can help you improve your own skills. Diversify your investments: The platform allows you to follow multiple traders with different styles. This means you can spread out your investments across various strategies, which can help reduce risk. Potential for passive income: By copying successful traders, you have the chance to earn money without needing to manage your portfolio actively. This makes it appealing to those who prefer a more hands-off approach to investing. Cons: Dependence on others: Your success on Iconomi relies on the traders you choose to follow. If they don't perform well, your results might suffer, which can be unpredictable. Limited control: Since you are essentially copying other traders, you have little control over the specific trades they make. This can be frustrating if you want to make your own decisions. Risk of scams: Social trading platforms like Iconomi can have risks, such as copy-trading scams or unreliable trading patterns. This means there’s a chance you could lose money if you follow the wrong traders. In summary, Iconomi offers opportunities to learn and potentially earn through social trading . However, your success depends heavily on the actions of others, which may not be ideal for people who are already experts or already have their own strategies. 3. Mudrex: Simplifying Crypto Investing with Bots Mudrex is a platform that aims to make cryptocurrency trading and investing easier by using automated bots. These bots are designed to help users manage their investments without needing to constantly monitor the market. On Mudrex, you'll find a marketplace where you can choose from a variety of pre-made trading bots. Each bot is built with a specific strategy and comes with different levels of risk, allowing you to select one that fits your investment style and comfort level. This means you can find a bot that matches your goals, whether you're looking for something more aggressive or a more conservative approach. By using these automated bots, you can save time and reduce the stress of trading. Instead of having to analyze the market and make trades manually, the bots do the work for you, following their programmed strategies. Pros and Cons of Mundrex While the idea of automating trades with bots seems interesting, let’s look at the pros and cons of using Mudrex for automated trading. Pros: Beginner-friendly: Mudrex is designed to be easy for new traders and investors. It provides a straightforward way to automate trading strategies, making it accessible for those who may not have much experience in trading. Diverse bot selection: The platform offers a wide variety of trading bots. This allows users to choose strategies that match their individual risk tolerance and investment goals, giving them flexibility in their trading approach. Backtesting capabilities: Mudrex enables users to test their bots using historical data. This feature allows traders to see how a bot would have performed in the past, helping them make more informed decisions before committing to using real funds. Cons: Reliance on bots: Since Mudrex primarily offers pre-built bots, users have limited control over customizing their own trading strategies. This can be restrictive for those who want to tailor their approach to specific market conditions. Potential for losses: While automated trading can save time, it’s important to remember that bots are not foolproof. They can still incur losses, especially in volatile market conditions, which can lead to financial setbacks for users. Fees: Mudrex charges fees for using its platform and accessing certain trading bots. These fees can reduce overall profits, making it important for users to consider the costs involved. Overall, Mudrex simplifies automated trading, making it a good option for those looking for an easy way to trade without extensive knowledge. However, it lacks some of the advanced features and community governance found in platforms like CryptoIndex. Additionally, the reliance on pre-made bots limits users' control and flexibility, so it may not suit everyone’s trading style. 4. BitMEX: High-Leverage Trading (For Experienced Traders Only) BitMEX is a trading platform for cryptocurrency derivatives. A key feature of BitMEX is that it offers high leverage which means you can borrow a large amount of money to increase the size of your trades. For example, if you have $1,000 and you use 100x leverage, you could trade as if you had $100,000. While this can lead to massive profits if the market goes your way, it also comes with a high risk of big losses. If the market moves against you, you could lose your entire investment very quickly. Because of these risks, BitMEX is mainly intended for experienced traders who are comfortable taking on high-risk strategies. It's not a good choice for beginners or those who prefer to avoid risky investments, as the potential for losing money is quite high. Pros and Cons of BitMEX While BitMEX presents many opportunities for experienced traders, it also carries risks and can be quite complex. Here are the main pros and cons of using BitMEX. Pros: High leverage: BitMEX allows you to borrow a large amount of money to trade, which can greatly increase your potential profits. However, this also means that your losses can be just as large if the market moves against you. Advanced tools: The platform provides sophisticated trading tools that are helpful for experienced traders. These tools can assist in executing complex trading strategies and managing risk. High trading activity: BitMEX has a lot of trading activity, meaning there are many buyers and sellers. This high liquidity makes it easier for you to buy and sell assets without causing major changes in their prices. Cons: Very risky: Trading with high leverage is risky and new traders might find it hard to manage these risks effectively. Compared to some other platforms, BitMEX exposes users to extreme volatility, where a single market movement can wipe out an entire position. While experienced traders may thrive in this high-risk environment, those seeking a more structured, strategic, and sustainable investment approach may find CryptoIndex a safer and more accessible alternative. Complex features: BitMEX requires advanced trading knowledge, risk management skills, and an understanding of leverage, making it inaccessible to most casual investors. High level of centralization: BitMEX operates as a centralized exchange, meaning all decisions, from trading policies to risk management, are controlled by the company. In summary, BitMEX is best suited for experienced traders who understand the risks involved in high-leverage trading. It may not be the right choice for the average cryptocurrency investor due to its high-risk nature and complex features. 5. Delta Exchange: Crypto Derivatives Trading Delta Exchange is a cryptocurrency derivatives exchange that offers a variety of trading options, such as crypto options, futures, and other advanced financial products. This platform is designed for experienced traders who are looking for more advanced trading tools and strategies. On Delta Exchange, you can engage in different types of derivatives trading, which allows you to speculate on the future price movements of cryptocurrencies. For example, you can trade options that give you the right to buy or sell a cryptocurrency at a specific price within a certain timeframe. Futures contracts allow you to agree to buy or sell a cryptocurrency at a set price on a future date. Because of its focus on advanced trading products, Delta Exchange is similar to BitMEX, another popular exchange in the crypto space. However, it may not be the best choice for beginners, as the complexity of these products requires a good understanding of trading concepts and risk management. Pros and Cons of Delta Exchange While Delta Exchange has several advantages, like a wide selection of derivatives and a user-friendly design, it also has some challenges, especially for newcomers. Here are the main strengths and weaknesses of using Delta Exchange. Pros: Variety of derivatives: Delta Exchange provides a wider range of derivative products than many other exchanges. This gives traders more choices when it comes to selecting the best products for their strategies. Advanced tools: The platform offers sophisticated trading tools that are helpful for experienced users. These tools allow traders to use more advanced strategies and better manage their trades. Good interface: Delta Exchange features an easy-to-use interface, making it simpler for traders to navigate the platform compared to some of its competitors. Cons: Very risky: Trading derivatives is inherently risky and can lead to huge losses, particularly for those who are not familiar with how these products work. Complex: The various products and features available on Delta Exchange can be confusing for beginners, which may make it hard for them to use the platform effectively. Lower liquidity: Delta Exchange may have lower liquidity compared to larger exchanges like BitMEX. This means that it can be more difficult to buy and sell assets quickly without impacting their prices. Like BitMEX, Delta Exchange is not right for most crypto investors because it's too risky and complex. Only those with experience are advised to use this platform. Conclusion: Opt for the Platform That Covers Your Needs When it comes to selecting the best crypto trading platform in 2025, it really depends on your personal experience, how much risk you are willing to take, and your investment goals. Different platforms like Mudrex, Iconomi, BitMEX, and Delta Exchange each offer their own unique features and advantages. However, CryptoIndex stands out as a strong option for many users. It provides a wide range of indexes, has an easy-to-use interface, and includes an innovative "Hold to Earn" feature. Additionally, its community-led governance makes it a popular choice among traders. Always remember to do your own research and think carefully about the risks involved before investing in any cryptocurrency or choosing a trading platform. Disclaimer: This article is provided for informational purposes only. It is not offered or intended to be used as legal, tax, investment, financial, or other advice.

title: Societe Generale-FORGE launches EUR-backed stablecoin on Stellar
body: Societe Generale-FORGE, a subsidiary of Societe Generale Group and licensed investment firm, has deployed its euro-backed stablecoin on the Stellar network. With several stablecoin issuers getting regulatory approval to offer the Markets in Crypto Assets-compliant stablecoins in Europe, SG-FORGE announced it selected Stellar ( XLM ) blockchain network for its own launch. On Feb. 20, Societe Generale-FORGE said its multi-chain strategy takes flight with the deployment of the MiCA-compliant stablecoin EURCV CoinVertible on Stellar. The digital euro stablecoin will leverage Stellar’s fast, scalable and cost-effective network, with the overall benefit to users being the boost this product will give to the blockchain platform’s cross-border payments ecosystem. In this case, SG-FORGE’s stablecoin will see further adoption across financial institutions and asset managers. “Our upcoming integration with Stellar represents a pivotal moment in bridging traditional finance with the digital asset ecosystem. Stellar’s approach and established connections with asset managers and TradFi institutions align perfectly with our mission to achieve broader adoption of stablecoins within the financial system,” Guillaume Chatain, chief revenue officer at SG-FORGE, said. You might also like: YLDS stablecoin debuts as first SEC-registered yield-bearing digital asset The integration will also not just bring EURCV to traditional finance users, but also bolster XLM utility in the broader decentralized finance and web3 space. One of the big developments the partnership will power is asset tokenization, a sector that continues to grow in leaps amid the entry of global behemoths such as BlackRock, Fidelity Investments and Franklin Templeton. Societe Generale-FORGE, founded in 2018, operates under Societe Generale Group. The firm’s operations includes digital asset and blockchain services and solutions, with these offered to institutional issuers and investors. It launched the EURCV stablecoin on Ethereum in April 2023. SG-FORGE previously revealed plans to debut the stablecoin on the XRP Ledger, with this targeted for 2025. The company has regulatory approval as an electronic money institution from the Autorité de Contrôle Prudentiel et de Résolution. It also holds a digital asset service provider license. DASP is a registration authorized by the financial markets regulator Autorité des Marchés Financiers. Read more: Societe Generale’s crypto division secures license in France
